Job Description
JOB TITLE: Stadium Attendant
REPORTS TO: Manager
DEPARTMENT: Operations
FLSA STATUS: Non-Exempt
OVERVIEW: The Stadium Attendant is responsible for getting (and keeping) the restaurant ready for Guests and is like a Team’s groundkeeper getting the field ready for a big game. Everything has to be ready for action. During the Stadium Attendant’s shift, it will be their job to ensure everything in their area is clean, stocked, and ready to go for Guests and their fellow Teammates!
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Setting the Table
Sets up all table caddies properly.
Ketchup in the middle with the Buffalo facing out, wet naps placed in a small container, and the specified marketing POP (if applicable) placed behind the ketchup. Salt should always be placed on the right, pepper on the left.
Ensures condiments and supplies in the caddies are full at all times.
Replace the drink menu in the center of the table for easy viewing and access during a table reset. Guests should see the Drink Menu first upon approaching the table or booth.
Places the caddy on the outside of the table or booth.
Soap and Sanitizer Buckets
Uses the proper red and green buckets for cleaning and sanitizing tables, chairs, infant seats, and table caddy contents.
Green buckets contain a soap solution, red bucket contain sanitizer. Remember, “Green is clean, Red is dead”.
Unless a restaurant’s local code specifies otherwise, as dual bucket system of soap and sanitizer solutions is required.
Clean towels should be placed into both buckets.
Buckets may also need to be placed at Greeter and Takeout Counter areas.
Flatware
Ensures that server and bar stations are kept stocked with rolled silverware.
Flatware rollups should include a fork and knife, rolled in a white paper napkin, held together with a white band wrap.
Flatware soaking bins filled with hot soapy water should be placed in the dish area. All dirty/use flatware are to be placed in these bins.
Once the bins are full, the flatware is to be run through the dishwasher.
Soaking bins must be refreshed every four (4) hours.
Important – Unused roll-ups left on tables are DIRTY. Napkins must be discarded and flatware placed in a soaking bin.
Table Turns
Resets tables within two (2) minutes of Guest departure as follows so tables can be turned quickly.
Clears the table.
Wipes the table and Table Caddy contents with soap solution (green bucket).
Sanitizes the table and Table Caddy contents (red bucket).
Cleans and sweeps the floor.
Resets the Table Caddy.
Places the drink menus on the table.
The Restrooms
Conducts thorough inspections and clean the restrooms before the doors open every day. (Reminders are set by timer and are usually located at the Outside Expo area or the Cashier or Greeter stand).
Hands MUST be washed before leaving the restroom EVERY time, no matter the reason the restroom was entered.
Miscellaneous
Cleans and organizes restaurant consistent with opening and closing duties as appropriate.
Fills ice bins at soda and bar stations.
Stocks service and bar stations with supplies and products.
Sweeps and mops floors.
Washes and wipes windows throughout the shift.
Wipes down bottles.
Moving and cleaning underside of tables and chairs.
Runs/Delivers food.
Pre-bussing.
Removes trash from both the dining areas and kitchen.
Washes dishes.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.
COMPETENCIES - To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Guest service mentality; has a genuine desire to serve the customer.
Manages difficult or emotional customer situations.
Responds promptly to customer needs.
Responds to requests for service and assistance.
Meets commitments.
Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming.
Strong verbal communication and listening skills.
Listens to others without interrupting.
Keeps emotions under control.
Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.
Speaks clearly and listens attentively to supervisors, and team members.
Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations.
Listens and gets clarification.
Gives and welcomes feedback.
Contributes to building a positive team spirit.
Puts success of team above own interests.
Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives.
Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
Presents numerical data effectively.
Able to read and interpret written information.
Shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences.
Follows policies and procedures.
Supports organization's goals and values.
Adapts to changes in the work environment.
Manages competing demands.
Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Is consistently at work and on time.
Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.
Follows instructions, responds to management direction.
Takes responsibility for own actions.
Keeps commitments
Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
Asks for and offers help when needed.
Approaches others in a tactful manner.
Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position.
Accepts responsibility for own actions.
Applies feedback to improve performance.
Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Meets productivity standards.
Completes work in timely manner.
Works quickly.
Observes safety and security procedures.
Determines appropriate action beyond guidelines.
Reports potentially unsafe conditions.
Uses equipment and materials properly.
Language, Math and Reasoning
Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in on and one and small group situations to customers, clients and other employees of the organization.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but involved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, and TRAINING:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:
There are no specific requirements for this position.
COMPUTER SKILLS:
There are no special computer skills required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS - The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 30 pounds.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, use hands to handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, talk, and hear.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee will rarely sit.
VISION REQUIREMENTS:
Peripheral vision (ability to observe an area that can be seen up and down or to the left and right while eyes are fixed on a given point).
Depth perception (three dimensional vision, ability to judge distances and spatial relationships).
Ability to adjust focus (ability to adjust the eye to bring an object into sharp focus).
WORK ENVIRONMENT - The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
This position works in an environment with moderate noise level.

The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity, equity and inclusion are drivers for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Yet we’re as diverse as the city we call home- culturally, ethically, in outlook and lifestyle. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai’s unrivaled record of achievement, education, and advancement as we revolutionize medicine together and participate actively as a leader within the Mount Sinai Health System by:
Serving as the primary resource management representative of the Mount Sinai leadership teams, committees, etc., and acting as the primary executive leader interface between Mount Sinai and key executives from the health systems’ vendors and partners.
Engaging with relevant thought leaders and policy-makers at the federal and state levels, and representing the Health System as assigned.
Using a lens of equity in establishing and promoting policies and procedures and providing opportunities for all to thrive.
Confronting racist, sexist or other inappropriate behavior and challenges exclusionary organizational practices and serving as a role model to promote anti-racist behaviors.
Inspiring and fostering an environment of anti-racist behaviors among and between departments and co-workers.
We work hard to acquire and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you can develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, can make an impact on quality patient care.
Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story!
Who We Are
Over 42,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve.
Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospital campuses, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Beth Israel Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai Morningside (formerly Mount Sinai St. Luke’s), and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai.
The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate, exclude, or treat people differently on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.
EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans

Research

Requisition no: 521599
Work type: Full Time

Grade: Grade 105
Categories: General Administration
Job Type: Officer of Administration
Bargaining Unit:
Regular/Temporary: Regular
End Date if Temporary:

Salary Range:

Position Summary

The Department of Pediatrics is seeking a Project Manager to join our team in a full time position to work within the division of Molecular Genetics. Columbia University Irving Medical Center’s Department of Pediatrics is a world leader in providing care for children. Our mission areas include Healthcare, Education and Research. We offer care for our patients in over 25 specialty areas as well as individualized care for complex cases. Our Residency, Fellowship and Graduate programs are among the best in the Nation. Our Clinical, Translational and Basic Science research features collaborations across specialties and stretches from the bench to bedside. We also have several active Clinical trials available to our patients. The candidate will be working with a dedicated team of physicians and researchers performing innovative research in genomic medicine. The candidate will play a key role in the supervision of multiple genomic medicine research projects and managing a team of research assistants. Opportunity to co-author journal publications and present at national meetings.

Responsibilities

Coordinates genomic research studies, including multisite genomic medicine NIH studies.
Project manager for multi-center studies and coordinators work across the study sites including organization of site research staff, IRB approvals and modifications, and central oversight of the bio specimens, genomic data, and clinical databases.
Obtains and maintains Columbia institutional review board (IRB) approval.
Manages a team of research assistants who recruit study participants, explain the study to prospective participants and assist with obtaining informed consent and study data.
Studies may include pre and post test genetic sessions to return research results and study the impact of receiving genomic data/a genetic diagnosis. Studies also include rare genetic diseases and coordination of protocols across national and international rare disease networks.
Encouraged to participate in data analysis, manuscript preparation, study design, and grant preparations.
Performs related duties & responsibilities as assigned/requested.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in education and experience required; plus four years of related experience.

Preferred Qualifications

Masters or doctoral degree in human genetics or genetic counseling is preferred but advanced degree in other areas will be considered.
Should have at least 4 years of experience in clinical research and preferably genetic research.
Should have experience in a supervisory role.

Other Requirements

Requires excellent oral and written communication, interpersonal, and managerial skills.
Experience with IRB submissions, research compliance, database software, and basic statistical analysis preferred.

Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

Columbia University is committed to the hiring of qualified local residents.

Type of Employment: Full Time


Travel %: None


Exemption Classification: Non-Exempt

Strength Through Diversity
Ground breaking science. Advancing medicine. Healing made personal.
Roles & Responsibilities:
The Bioinformatician I manages and organizes large databases, and conducts statistical and genomic analysis. Uses software to gather, store, manipulate and analyzes research data.
The Bioinformatician I will work with a group of researchers/biologists on innovative genomic analyses of structural variation, epigenetics, and gene expression in an integrated environment combining experimental and bioinformatics approaches to human disease. The individual will support research projects by delivering bioinformatics services for bio-medical data from cutting-edge genomic technologies

The ideal candidate will have strong statistical and programming proficiencies with proven expertise in genomic analysis.
Writes custom scripts for analysis of genomic data derived from high-throughput techniques.
Designs and implements bioinformatics tools and processes in order to analyze large-scale datasets.
Identifies and resolves technical issues and proposes upgrades to current software.
Develop projects and work independently on a variety of bioinformatics analysis projects.
Manages databases, conducts statistical and genomic analysis, and participates in the preparation of manuscripts and presentations.
May be involved in sequence and structural analysis, data mining, or statistical modeling.
May collaborate with wet-bench biologists and work independently to analyze data derived from several types of projects using microarrays and high-throughput sequencing.
May conduct analysis of microarray and high-throughput sequencing data, genome sequence analysis, experimental design and statistical analysis.
May give presentations both inside and outside of the institution.
Other related duties as assigned.
Requirements:
B.S. in Biological Sciences, Bioinformatics, Computer Sciences, Statistics or related discipline; M.S. preferred
Good organization and communication skills, with demonstrated ability to productively work as a member of a team. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English are required
3 years of experience required
Working experience with genetics or statistics analysis software and online resources. Experience in programming environments such as Matlab, R statistical package, BioConductor, Perl or C++.
Strength Through Diversity
The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity, equity and inclusion are drivers for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Yet we’re as diverse as the city we call home- culturally, ethically, in outlook and lifestyle. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai’s unrivaled record of achievement, education, and advancement as we revolutionize medicine together and participate actively as a leader within the Mount Sinai Health System by:
Serving as the primary resource management representative of the Mount Sinai leadership teams, committees, etc., and acting as the primary executive leader interface between Mount Sinai and key executives from the health systems’ vendors and partners.
Engaging with relevant thought leaders and policy-makers at the federal and state levels, and representing the Health System as assigned.
Using a lens of equity in establishing and promoting policies and procedures and providing opportunities for all to thrive.
Confronting racist, sexist or other inappropriate behavior and challenges exclusionary organizational practices and serving as a role model to promote anti-racist behaviors.
Inspiring and fostering an environment of anti-racist behaviors among and between departments and co-workers.
We work hard to acquire and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you can develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, can make an impact on quality patient care.
Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story!
Who We Are
Over 42,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve.
Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospital campuses, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Beth Israel Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai Morningside (formerly Mount Sinai St. Luke’s), and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai.
The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate, exclude, or treat people differently on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.

Tribeca Pediatrics provides personalized pediatric care, guidance, and support to children and families in the communities we serve. Our success is reinvested in the practice and has funded our growth as we open local primary care facilities throughout New York, New Jersey, and California. It's our goal to empower our families with resources and tools to ensure their children meet their developmental milestones to become the leaders of tomorrow.
About the Position:
The Facilities Director maintains properties and facilities for Tribeca Pediatrics and MC commercial properties. Coordinates MC Fabrications Shop team for build-out schedule, oversees inventory and creates, analyzes and evaluates budgets for projects and inventory.

Coordinate facilities maintenance for Tribeca Pediatrics offices and MC properties
Arrange contractors and services for maintenance issues (plumbing, extermination, HVAC, cleaning, roofing, glass and doors, flooring, etc)
Oversee and resolve issues relating to office equipment, refrigeration and temperature excursions.
Facilitate and coordinate weekend maintenance
Coordinate cleaning/window cleaning teams based on need
Collaborate with bookkeepers/accountants on utility charges that are out of range
Oversee door lock, access control and security of office(s)
Work with Construction Manager in maintenance and fabrication
Collaborate on projects with various departments using Smartsheet
Keep track of and aid with administrative duties related to Tribeca Pediatrics
Generate weekly reports of completed projects across the entire company
Generate weekly reports of completed maintenance
Schedule and conduct bi-weekly department meetings
Expansion and build-out

Plan office expansions and new office build-outs with all related teams
Coordinate new office set up (CLIA certificates, ensure new accounts are opened)
Order equipment for new offices


Fabrications Shop

Manage MC Fabrication Shop employees
Inventory and catalog items produced by MC Fabrications Shop
Ordering of materials and supplies (Paints, tools, etc) for MC Fabrications Shop
Site visits to Fabrications Shop and storage facilities as needed
Tracking and follow up of all orders (Amazon, Ebay, Paypal, etc)


Office Inventory Oversight

Support and back-up Inventory Manager as needed
Oversees budget of inventory
Ensure systems are working efficiently

Minimum of High School Diploma or equivalent
Must be computer savvy

Experience with Smartsheet or other project management software

Normal office environment/Fabrication shop

job_description:
DISH Media connects brands with consumers across DISH and Sling TV through industry-leading addressable and programmatic advertising.We provides smart and effective media solutions that complement those of traditional national cable. DISH Media is here to help you make a real impression. The DISH Network family is committed to offering the highest-quality entertainment and most advanced technology all at an unbeatable value.
Based out of New York City, with offices in Chicago, Denver and Los Angeles, our team is an innovative, passionate and fun group working hard and finding reward in the radically changing TV advertising landscape.
The Data & Analytics team within Media Sales works closely with the corporate DISH Viewer Measurement team to combine powerful household level reporting data, analytics and expertise that helps our sales staff succeed in a rapidly evolving environment. Constructing automated processes through scripting languages, using data to identify and create models of an advertiser’s target audience, measuring the success of an advertiser’s campaign and providing visualization through self-service tools are just a few of the day to day tasks this team is responsible for.
We are now seeking a Data Scientist that will support the on-air addressable Media Sales team and Data Sales efforts through:
Strong Data Science Stack (e.g. R, Python, SQL, producing visualizations in Tableau, etc.)
Developing critical analytics and propensity models using key DISH data sources including the viewer measurement data and DISH CRM data.
Working with the Account Executives and clients to develop client proposals based on conducted research.
Demonstrating thought leadership by writing papers, attending conferences and promoting yourself as subject matter expert on topics such subscriber and network viewership trends.
Developing key relationship with Analytics heads at advertising agencies, data partners, internal divisions and other key industry players.
Architect and develop new advertising products using state of the art machine learning algorithms either in a big data environment such as Hadoop or in a cloud-based environment such as AWS.
A successful Data Scientist Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university; advanced degree in a STEM field preferred. AWS Certification highly valued.
3-5 years of working experience utilizing data modeling techniques.
Familiarity with big data projects, tools, and technique, segmentation and ad targeting.
Experience with SQL and scripting tools; willingness to be hands on where needed.
Excellent communication skills and have the proven ability to manage multiple projects and meeting deadlines.
Experience working with IT and / or DBAs in respect to projects involving large databases.
Strong work ethic; personable and must be able to prioritize tasks and deliverables in a fast-paced Sales environment.

This role is responsible for the execution of sales and service activities in coordination with key internal partners.

Responsibilities:

Deepen existing client relationships by investing time getting to know your clients, transforming these learnings into meaningful recommendations, and staying connected beyond the point of sale
Represent Citibank as a brand ambassador, an expert on Citi’s products and their benefits and an educator on digital innovations

Understand and comply with Citibank policies, standards and procedures to ensure the security of the bank’s and clients’ assets

2-4 years of relevant experience
NMLS registration; Safe Act compliant
Previous banking, retail, or sales experience preferred
Proficient sales skills
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Proficient computer skills and banking technology skills
Demonstrated ability to cultivate relationships and identify and execute on opportunities for growth
Confident, articulate, and empathetic; able to successfully build trust, overcome objections or concerns, and uncover unstated needs through both in-person and remote channels
Comfortable performing inbound/outbound sales activities including developing and executing a sales plan and clearly communicating features and benefits of financial products/services
Flexible and adaptable; able to quickly assess a situation and identify next steps
Digitally savvy; comfortable adopting new technologies, explaining digital tools to clients, and interacting with clients across multiple channels (both in-person and virtual)
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills; able to engage in sensitive discussions on financial goals and needs.
Team oriented and collaborative; able to maintain strong relationships with partners and create a seamless referral experience for clients when appropriate
Excellent attention to detail
Strong integrity and professionalism

High School diploma or equivalent

About Us: Volunteers of America-Greater New York (VOA-GNY) is an anti-poverty organization that seeks to end homelessness in the New York metropolitan area by the year 2050. We focus our continuum of care to address the most prevalent causes of homelessness: (1) lack of affordable housing; (2) unmet health needs, including but not limited to mental health and substance use; and (3) lack of jobs that create wealth. In each of these areas we strive to incorporate strategies that address issues of racial equity. We know that our clients are confronting longstanding barriers to accessing quality housing, healthcare, and employment.

Our programs are designed to ensure that our clients do not have to face these challenges alone. Now in our second century of serving those in need, VOA-GNY understands what it takes to heal families and individuals who are in crisis and have experienced trauma. We operate and provide services in emergency shelters, transitional housing, and permanent supportive housing for close to 11,000 men, women and children through 65 programs located in New York City, Northern New Jersey, and Westchester annually. We are one of the largest providers of services to families and individuals experiencing homelessness in the Greater New York area, serving survivors of domestic violence, people living with HIV/AIDS, veterans, and others who have behavioral health or substance use needs.

Many of VOA-Greater New York’s programs are nationally recognized and meet the rigorous standards of accrediting bodies CARF, COA and the NAEYC. "Successful applicants must be vaccinated for COVID-19 before their start date with VOA-GNY, unless you have been approved by VOA-GNY for a medical or religious exception to this requirement." Notre mission:
Nos étudiants sont au coeurs de nos préoccupations et notre mission est de permettre à tout le monde, même aux personnes les plus occupées, de maîtriser une langue et développer leur potentiel - partout et à tout moment.

Aimeriez-vous enseigner à des étudiants du monde entier sans quitter le confort de votre domicile ?

Êtes-vous motivé, autonome, un as de la technologie et également intéressé pour devenir éducateur indépendant dans notre salle de classe du futur ?

Si la réponse à toutes ces questions est oui, nous serions ravis de faire votre connaissance !

A propos de Lingoda...

Lingoda se place au premier rang de l'apprentissage en ligne depuis 2013 ; en changeant activement la façon d'apprentissage d'une langue.
Notre plate-forme virtuelle haut de gamme offre un environnement de cours en ligne idéal, en offrant plus de 11000 cours par semaine.

Travailler à nos côtés chez Lingoda signifie que vous faites partie d'une entreprise en développement constant et qui améliore considérablement l'avenir de l'apprentissage en ligne.

Tâches

Vos compétences et votre expérience

\- Le français est votre langue maternelle (niveau C2+ minimum).
\- Vous n’avez pas de difficulté à parler anglais
\- Vous avez acquis de l'expérience dans le domaine de l'éducation.
\- Vous étudiez ou avez terminé vos études au FLE ou dans un domaine similaire (DAEFLE, ou Masters en éducation).
\- Vous êtes disponible pour travailler de manière flexible (max. 20h/semaine).
\- Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en gestion du temps et organisation autonome.
\- Vous êtes proactif dans votre méthodologie d'enseignement.
\- Vous prenez des initiatives pour résoudre les problèmes et faire participer les élèves.

Exigences

Les indispensables

\- Vous êtes légalement apte à exercer en tant que Freelancer.
\- Équipement technique (connexion internet haut débit, casque avec microphone, ordinateur fixe/portable avec caméra).
\- Environnement de travail confortable et silencieux.

Avantages

Notre offre pour vous

\- La chance de prendre part activement à l'avenir de l'apprentissage des langues
\- Matériel d'apprentissage entièrement fourni
Notre curriculum (plan pédagogique) sera mis à votre disposition, avec du matériel didactique spécialement conçu par notre équipe de Didactics.
\- Horaires de travail flexibles
Vous êtes responsable de vos horaires hebdomadaires.
\- La possibilité de travailler de n'importe où tant que vous avez une connexion internet haut débit
Travailler à partir de votre domicile - ou travailler pendant que vous voyagez tant que vous disposez d'une connexion internet stable.
\- Enseignement à l'international
Rencontrer, enseigner et apprendre à des étudiants venant du monde entier dans un environnement en ligne agréable.

\- Remises commerciales:
25% de réduction sur tous nos cours de langues - abonnements espagnol, allemand et anglais.
Bonus de parrainage si vous parrainez des professeurs d'allemand pour travailler à nos côtés.

Si vous souhaitez devenir professeur de français chez Lingoda, merci de postulez sur notre page officiel.
Nous nous réjouissons de vous rencontrer virtuellement : )

Position Summary: The Operations Coordinator, under the supervision of, and reporting to, the Asset Manager, will be responsible for overseeing Selfhelp’s housing portfolio’s operational and physical plant activities. The Operations Coordinator will work with third-party professionals (including property management, energy engineers, etc.) to identify issues, prepare scopes and execute maintenance projects. In addition, the Operations Coordinator may provide assistance in the management of Selfhelp’s scattered program spaces.
Principal Responsibilities:
Maintain and improve building operations and maintenance protocols, with an emphasis on energy systems

The Server / Bartender is able to fill both of these important roles, responsibility focused of informing, selling and serving both food and drinks to our guests in a professional manner.
The suggestive selling of our served food paired with guest pleasing beverages are key to success in this dual role serving our guests.
Server Responsibilities/Qualifications:
Able to pass Responsible Service of Alcohol Test with a score of 90% or better.
Serve three to four tables, as determined by management.
Have complete knowledge of the Restaurant’s food and beverage preparation.
Able to use a computer POS system to enter orders on a check.
Able to interact with guests in a friendly and efficient manner.
Able to accept different types of payment and make change.
Maintain specific side-work and ensure the total cleanliness and smooth operation of the restaurant.
Ability to clear and reset tables.
Check identification of guests to ensure guests are of legal age to consume alcoholic beverages. Refuse to serve beverages in a polite manner to guests who are not of legal age.
Bartender Responsibilities/Qualifications :
Must be able to pass Responsible Service of Alcohol Test with a score of 90% or better.
Welcome each guests personally within 30 seconds.
Communicate with guests using clear and enthusiastic words, tone and body language at all times. Make guests feel appreciated through bartender's actions.
Work as a team with all personnel to maintain an effective atmosphere and an efficient food and beverage service.
Work with others to keep all areas cleaned and stocked to the restaurant's standards at all times.
Mix, garnish and serve alcoholic and nonalcoholic drinks for patrons of bar and dining room following standard recipes.
Enter drink orders into computer immediately, collect money from guests for drinks served and make change.
Arrange bottles and glasses to maintain an attractive display in agreement with our restaurant standards.
Wash and sterilize stemware.
Be attentive! Offer assistance before the guest has to ask for it.
Count drinks guests are served.
Place current bar tabs in front of guests at all times.
Monitor and ensure that no guest receives more than the allowed number of specific drinks.
Required of Server/Bartender :
Anticipate your guest's needs. Follow the half-full rule when offering another drink. Be alert of guest signals (raising a hand, making eye contact, etc.), and acknowledge the guest to let them know you’ll will be right with them.
Learn guests' names, occupations and favorite drinks; personalizing the guests’ restaurant experience.
Serve alcohol responsibly. Should a guest reach the state where the bartender does not feel the guest should drive, supply a taxi. Do not hesitate to ask for management intervention if necessary.
High school diploma or GED.
Prior experience working in a restaurant.
Basic knowledge of beer, wine and spirits, and familiarity with standard drink recipes.
Prior experience as a bartender.
Must be 21 or older.
Must maintain an applicable state health and/or alcohol compliance card.
Work Environment:
This job operates both behind the bar and in the restaurant setting. It may involve working in close proximity to co-workers. The noise level in the work environment can be loud. Hazards may include, but not limited to, cuts, slipping and tripping.
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The employee is required to sit, stand, reach, lift, bend, kneel, stoop, climb, push and pull items weighing 50 pounds or less. The position requires manual dexterity; auditory and visual skills; and the ability to follow written and oral instructions and procedures.
Benefits: We offer a competitive wage, benefits, career advancement opportunities and more!
Join us in the Server / Bartender Position – Apply Today!

Basic Job Function: This service position is an entry-level role for Maison Kayser’s kitchens. Primary responsibilities include checking in the food delivery orders, rotating and storing all items in their respective areas, and organizing all product according to planogram standards. Washing all kitchen items for the Cooks & Grab & Go Prep and assisting with maintaining a clean and sanitary environment. The job also includes sweeping, mopping and cleaning of equipment (such as mixers, slicers, peelers, fryers, blender and counters), as well as maintaining the cleanliness of the café floor, outside vestibule and all bathrooms in the location.

Task/Requirements: • Prepare storage areas for incoming deliveries and check all temperatures on refrigeration equipment to ensure that they are working properly. • Check in deliveries using the appropriate purchase order sheet and verify all quantities of goods. • Notify manager of any shortages or damaged product. • Make sure that the purchase order items and quantities match the invoice and make any necessary adjustments to the invoice (shorts, returns, or damaged).


Ensure that organization and cleanliness of storage areas are maintained at all times. • Comply with and fully understand the laws and regulations regarding licensing, food safety, health & safety, fire equipment and fire training. • Continually monitor that your working area is fully clean and in accordance with health department standards. • Immediately report any safety issues, accidents or damaged/faulty equipment to a senior team member.
Additional duties/projects as directed by Store Management Minimum Requirements: • Must be organized, and detail-oriented • Ability to understand the difference between a purchase order and an invoice. • Basic math skills, and the ability to write clearly. • Ability to understand the difference between Delivery Upon Arrival, Parcel Delivery, and Night Drop Delivery. • Be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 6 hours).
Maintain a comfort level of working in or around areas of extreme heat (ovens) and cold (walk-in freezers) • Ability to understand and demonstrate all of Maison Kayser’s Core Values: Authenticity, Innovation, Quality, Passion • Ability to meet all Maison Kayser Behaviors: Teamwork, Willing to Learn, Open to Feedback, Passion Education and Experience: • Previous experience in a kitchen/BOH environment is strongly preferred, but not required for the right candidate! • Must have a "can do" work ethic and the ability to handle a fast-paced environment. • Previous exposure to high-pressure situations and a demonstrated ability to communicate needs and progress/status during rush periods. • Must be able to lift and carry up to 25 lbs.
Maison Kayser is an Equal Opportunity Employer*

The Transportation Planning and Management Division is seeking a Transportation Specialist to serve as Curb Analytics Program Manager within the Special Projects Unit. The Special Projects unit is responsible for fostering data-informed transportation planning. The Special Projects Unit within the Division of Transportation Planning is responsible for fostering data-informed transportation planning and developing cross-cutting research initiatives, policies, and programs that support the efficient use of NYC streets and curb spaces through prioritization of high performance modes.


The Curb Analytics Program Manager would work to analyze, study, and respond to curb planning, development, and implementation issues associated with the expanding set of curb programs, ensuring strict compliance to internal controls and adherence to standardized policies. These programs include, but are not limited to, Open Restaurants, Off Hour Deliveries, Neighborhood Loading Zones, and Carshare programs, as well as general freight, taxi and FHV loading and relief zones. In addition, the Program Manger would work with programs across Regional and Strategic Planning as well as the Transportation Planning and Management and Traffic Operations Divisions. In addition, the selected candidate will conduct special complex studies and prepare reports, perform analyses, and make recommendations on policies and procedures and conduct business and stakeholder education and outreach where appropriate. The ideal candidate should be detail oriented, accurate and capable team player with a positive attitude and possess excellent oral and written communication skills. The candidate will be asked to work collaboratively and inclusively, seeking to cultivate continued professional development and effectively communicate with all stakeholders. This is an opportunity to work with a team dedicated to improving safety, accessibility and mobility throughout New York City.

The Department of Transportation’s (DOT) mission is to provide for the safe, efficient, and environmentally responsible movement of people and goods in the City of New York and to maintain and enhance the transportation infrastructure crucial to the economic vitality and quality of life of our primary customers, City residents. DOT is an equal opportunity employer, committed to recruiting and maintaining a diverse workforce in an open and inclusive environment.
Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A master's degree in transportation engineering, mathematics, urban planning, architecture, landscape architecture, urban studies, or related physical and social science fields; or

2. A baccalaureate degree in engineering from an accredited college and one year of full-time satisfactory experience performing technical work on roadway transportation and traffic studies and area-wide traffic programs; or

3. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and two years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in "2" above; or

4. An associate degree or completion of 60 semester credits from an accredited college and four years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in "2" above; or

5. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and six years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in "2" above.

SPECIAL NOTE:

In addition to meeting the minimum Qualification Requirements above:

To be assigned to Assignment Level II, the candidate must have an additional year of experience as described in the "Qualification Requirements" listed under "2" above.

To be assigned to Assignment Level III, the candidate must have an additional two years of experience as described in the "Qualification Requirements" listed under "2" above.
Preferred Skills

Excellent communication (oral and written), presentation, and analytical skills; experience working with New York City agencies and community groups; project management experience; the ability to read site plans; attention to detail; and familiarity with contracts, legal documents, rules and regulations, and/or City procurement are strongly preferred. Preference also given to candidates possessing database programing and management skills, GIS, graphic design skills, data-mining knowledge or interest, and prior supervisory experience. Bilingual/multi-lingual is a plus.
Additional Information

This position is open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a program. Please indicate in your resume or cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position under the 55-a program.
To Apply

All resumes are to be submitted electronically using one of the following methods:
External applicants, go to www.nyc.gov/careers and search for Job ID # 511095
Current city employees, log into Employee Self Service at www.nyc.gov/ess and follow the Careers link and search for Job ID # 511095
No phone calls, faxes or personal inquiries permitted.
Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.
Most public libraries have computers available for use.
Note: New hires must reside in NYC for the first two years of employment. Appointments are subject to OMB approval.
For more information about DOT, visit us at: www.nyc.gov/dot.
Hours/Shift

9am – 5pm
Work Location

55 Water St Ny Ny
Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

job_description: DESCRIPTIONLinear Financial Technologies is a fast-growing fintech company formed on the premise that technology and data can transform the way businesses access financial products, thus removing friction from the experience. We have a large and growing set of blue-chip clients, including 6 of the top 25 commercial banks. Our clients and solutions span industries including banks, non-bank lenders, commerce platforms, and suppliers.The core of what we provide is a cutting-edge SaaS platform that simplifies the journey for businesses to gain access to capital and open accounts, allowing owners to focus on their passion - running their businesses. Embedded in the solution is a decade of insights, accompanied by the power of AI/ML technologies to enable intelligent business decisions. The global Talent Development team works with and through Human Resources to provide practical, relevant, and enduring talent development solutions for professionals, managers, and leaders globally. The role is based in New York, and liaises globally.
This position serves as a key liaison with HR Business Partners and business leaders to identify, scope, and create development solutions for Company and Infrastructure businesses.
Key Responsibilities
Liaise with HR Business Partners, Business Leaders, and Talent Development to identify, scope, create, and evaluate leader, manager, and professional talent development initiatives.
Recommend relevant, practical, and enduring talent development solutions, in line with key business goals and talent development model.
Advocate and create buy-in for Morgan Stanley’s talent development model
Work with HR Business Partners (and business stakeholders, as needed) to create and execute a development strategy for clients
Liaise with the broader Talent Development team globally in order to create greater impact, consistency and efficiency of development initiatives.
Partner with Talent Advisors globally to share best practices such as (but not limited to):
Business talent development trends
Operationalizing the Talent Development model
Building HR and business relationships
Advising on the application of talent development best practices
Identification and use of vendors
Analyze and translate key talent development data to better understand needs, and drive outcomes.
Support logistics, such as invoicing and vendor onboarding.

Skills Required
Is able to translate adult learning and organizational development theories into relevant and practical development solutions.
Is excellent at building and maintaining working relationships
Is highly collaborative; is able to work effectively with diverse colleagues and peers to deliver results
Is able to communicate clearly, articulate complex ideas in simple ways, and influence others through data
Is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where priorities shift; remains calm under pressure to deliver results
Has strong time/workload management skills and attention to detail; exhibits an ability to prioritize and work independently, multi-task and meet deadlines
Demonstrates excellent verbal, written, presentation and persuasion skills
Manages ambiguity
Is resilient, self-aware and a team player

QUALIFICATIONS
Experience
7+ years working in a corporate environment – preferably in HR or financial services
Understanding of current issues and best practices in talent development, including a clear understanding of how it drives commercial results in a financial services environment

Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with other experts in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?
Want to make an impact that matters? Consider Deloitte Global.
Work you'll do:
As the Communications manager for the global Maestro program, you will help develop and execute activation strategies across a complex group of global stakeholders in support of executive insights and experiences. You’ll accelerate the evolution of global eminence/thought leadership, along with the rollout of new concepts and programs in support of elevating relationship-building with the C-Suite and Board.
Your work will pave the way for a matrixed organization to go to market with a unified voice, including Signature Issue insights that address essential topics for global executives and board members as they deal with disruption on many fronts – topics such as resilient leadership, organizational trust, climate/ESG and digital transformation. This includes managing various communications plans and utilizing a vast network of global internal channels to promote ways to transform and better orchestrate our global eminence efforts.
Reporting to the Maestro Communications and Marketing Director, you’ll focus on storytelling, writing, copy editing, message development and PowerPoint slide creation to bring new concepts to life internally among Deloitte professionals. You’ll help advance cross-Signature Issue communications strategy, alumni comms strategy and connect the dots across various program components, including:
Developing creative internal campaigns to break through the clutter
Producing consistent positioning and messaging across the firm internally and externally
Capturing results and conducting metrics and ROI analysis to assess success and inform campaign development
Building relationships and collaborating cross-firm with other communicators and marketers, creatives and leaders across multiple geographies
Developing and executing communications plans
Liaising with marketing professionals to support external promotional efforts with complementary internal tactics
What you'll be part of - our Deloitte Global Culture:

At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and implement global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network.

In Deloitte Global, everyone has opportunities. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark.
Who you'll work with:
Maestro looks to elevate our executive programs to drive more impactful Board and C-Level relationships, while enhancing the Deloitte brand position. As part of this aspiration we deliver a number of key programs to anticipate, understand, and serve CEO, Board and CXO agendas.
How you'll grow:

Deloitte Global inspires our people at every level. We believe in investing in you, helping you at every step of your career, and helping you identify and hone your unique strengths. We encourage you to grow by providing formal and informal development programs, coaching, and mentoring. We want you to ask questions, take chances, and explore the possible.

Benefits you'll receive:

Deloitte’s Total Rewards program reflects our continued commitment to lead from the front in everything we do — that’s why we take pride in offering a comprehensive variety of programs and resources to support your health and well-being needs. We provide the benefits, competitive compensation, and recognition to help sustain your efforts in making an impact that matters.
Corporate Citizenship:

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people, and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.

Vice President/Senior Specialist, Line of Business Operational Risk (Wealth Management)
The Wealth Management Senior Risk Specialist supports the Head of WM Operational Risk and is responsible for ensuring Wealth Management’s compliance and alignment with the corporate operational risk management framework. The primary function of this role is to provide review and challenge to the WM business in its day-to-day activities, processes, and implementation of the operational risk tools and to provide quality assurance via analysis and reporting. This is achieved through direct interaction with WM business leaders and subject matter experts as well as working with business partners in legal, compliance, Corporate Operational Risk Management (CORM) and Enterprise Risk Assurance (ERA).
Key responsibilities include:
Maintain Operational Risk Management Framework (including WM Risk & Control Self-Assessments, Key Risk Indicators, Gaps, and Action plans); ensure information contained in Risk Management Platform is up-to-date (annual concurrences, action plans), accurate and of appropriate quality.
Ensure timely capture, notification, and reporting of Operational Risk Events, completion of Lessons Learned template and Root-Cause Analysis and event linkage where required. Conduct analysis of loss events to determine trends or opportunities for improvement. Review operational risk events to ensure accuracy and consistency with supporting documentation.
Develop, compile and maintain Risk Reporting for WM Operational Risk Forum, WM Business Risk Committee and BNY Mellon, N.A. Senior Risk and Control Committee and modify and/or enhance as required. Leveraging operational risk information contained in the Risk Management Platform, compile monthly Risk Report to evidence review and challenge and to facilitate discussions with WM business whereby issues are communicated.
Support the Head of WM Operational Risk with the LoB Scenario Analysis program. Compile risk data, communicate policy requirements and timelines and distribute workshop materials to the WM business leaders and business partners.
Review Key Indicators, Root Cause, Actions and Target Dates provided by WM for Red and Amber KRI conditions. Provide challenge where appropriate and document WM Risk review and challenge in Risk Commentary.
Review the quarterly Health Checks distributed by ERA, Internal Audit and Compliance Testing Reports and Regulatory Exam results to ensure issues identified are reflected in the RCSAs and/or Gaps/Actions.

Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
7-10 years of total work experience preferred.

Fund Services – FATCA/CRS Analyst

Job Number: 3196696
POSTING DATE: Dec 31, 2021
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Fund Services
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Associate

DESCRIPTION
Fund Services – FATCA/CRS Analyst
Position: Sr. Associate/Manager
Reports To: FATCA/CRS US Team Leader
Introduction and Job Purpose:

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.
Fund Services
This wholly owned subsidiary of Morgan Stanley administers over $500 billion of hedge fund assets. Using the firm’s proprietary, globally accessible technology platform, the business provides a full range of fund administration services, including daily accounting and financial reporting; transfer agency and investor services; middle and back-office support; and integrated portfolio analytics. Morgan Stanley Fund Services is supported by more than 1,100 professionals based in New York, London, Hong Kong, Dublin, Glasgow, Mumbai, and Bangalore.

The U.S. Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA), and Common Reporting Standard (CRS) are regulations that impose upon affected Financial Institutions a due diligence and reporting regime of their Account Holders to interested governments and tax authorities. Impacting hedge funds and their investors, the rules are part of a global effort to enforce international tax compliance and transparency. Over 100 countries participate in the two regimes and automatically exchange Account Holder information with each other annually.

The global FATCA/CRS Team specializes in and supports hedge fund clients with these regulations and related tax matters. FATCA/CRS Analysts are responsible for the daily review of fund investor documentation for reasonableness, completeness, and compliance with the aforementioned rules regimes. FATCA/CRS Analysts work with representatives in Investor Services to process documentation during client and investor on boarding and communicate deficiencies to investors. The FATCA/CRS Analyst also serves as an escalation point for internal, client, or investor queries, and works directly with clients to assist them in fulfilling their filing and other obligations as needed. Staff for this function is located in Manhattan and Westchester, New York and Mumbai, India.

QUALIFICATIONS
Key Responsibilities:
Service delivery at standards that meet client expectations.Act as a primary contact point for client funds and assist with their FATCA/CRS related queries and obligations.Assist fund investors with their FATCA/CRS related queries where needed.Review FATCA/CRS documentation provided in connection with investor on-boarding (i.e. IRS Form W-9/W-8 and Self-Certifications) for completeness, reasonableness, and compliance with the regulations.Apply the appropriate Account Holder classification to investors.Utilize proprietary software to draft standardized emails to investors noting deficiencies, errors, or omissions in their FATCA/CRS documentation.This role has particular responsibility for the second level review of activity entered by fellow team members.
Team participation:
FATCA/CRS Analysts work as a member of a global team. Frequent interaction will include work with colleagues whose focus is on fund accounting, AML, and Investor Services.
Projects:
FATCA/CRS Analysts have opportunities to participate in various IT and Operational Projects. Contributions include:
Identifying system enhancements that reduce operational risk, create operational efficiency or improve customer service.Participating in the key elements of the project life cycle (Specification, Testing and Operational Implementation).Participating in the conversion of records from other administrators.
Qualifications, experience, and skills needed:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or Management; a focus in Accounting, Finance, Tax, Law, or similar field preferred.Current working experience in FATCA/CRS.Knowledge of the regulatory requirements for IRS W-8s, W-9s and CRS Self-Certification Forms.Experience working with Chapter 61 and Chapter 3 information reporting a plus.Interest in learning new regulations and assisting others in understanding them.Knowledge of the financial services industry, particularly hedge funds, a significant benefit.Strong analytical skills and high attention to detail.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Good team player and ability to work independently with little supervision but also knows when to seek help and escalate issues where necessary.An ability to use key financial systems and other IT tools.Very strong organizational skills, particularly the ability to keep track of multiple open items at once and prioritize

About us

At Jumbo, we believe we can make the internet a safer place for everyone. We want to empower our users to take action on their privacy, data, and security at the touch of a button.

 Our vision: Navigate the internet on your own terms because Jumbo will protect you and your family wherever the internet takes you.

With over 300,000 weekly active users and $30M in funding (from Thrive Capital, Index Ventures and Balderton Capital, who were early investors in Instagram, Patreon, Github, Outbrain, Segment, etc), our app has been featured in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store. We have also been highlighted in major publications, such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Fast Company, TechCrunch, The Verge and many more. Jumbo is on a tremendous trajectory, and we're looking for extremely talented people to help us scale even faster!
Your Role as a Talent Sourcer

You are a high performing Talent Sourcer who can build & cultivate strong pipelines of A-players to get them excited about working at Jumbo.

You have 1-2 years of experience sourcing for technical and/or non-technical roles at a consumer technology company. You're highly personable, pride yourself on being able to deliver results, and are motivated by the challenge of supporting the Jumbo team in hiring 20+ roles in the next year.

Your Impact as a Talent Sourcer

Own mission-critical sourcing for 20+ roles post Series A fundraising
Work closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing and Operations teams in defining requirements of new roles and targeted objectives that are in alignment with company's goals
Find and engage both active and passive candidates through use of recruiting platforms (LinkedIn, etc), Boolean strings, and other alternative sourcing solutions
Develop and leverage 'out of the box' sourcing strategies to consistently build and maintain strong pipelines for technical and non-technical positions
Review resumes and screen candidates to identify qualitifications and interest level
Coordinate candidate outreach and interview schedules across all teams
Ensure high level data integrity within Greenhouse ATS and be an advocate for data-driven recruiting & reporting

You in a Nutshell

You have 1-2 years of experience sourcing for tehnical and non-technical roles with an in-house recruiting team, preferably at a consumer technology company
You have a track record of executing successful sourcing strategies that yield quality active and passive leads for high priority & complex roles
You have the ability to work cross-functionally and communicate effectively in fast-paced environments
You are hyperorganized and have managed interview schedules across multiple teams
You are a culture carrier who thrives on setting the tone for and inspiring others
You are technologically literate and have had past experience working with Greenhouse, LinkedIn, Google Suites, etc.
Bonus if you have experience working in fast paced environments (tech or high growth start-ups )
Bonus if you have heard of the WHO hiring methodology before and know how the process works

Your Work Culture

You're humble and biased to action, with a "no task is too small" mindset
You're data-driven, easily able to separate opinion from fact
You like a challenge and see one as an opportunity for growth
You think like an owner and can prioritize what's best for the company
Being nice matters to you, and you're a self-proclaimed diversity champion

How we will Support You

An awesome team! You'll work closely with people who have successful track-records in consumer product development.
Equity ownership in the company to share in the upside of what we're building together. We grant equity based on a transparent grid and with employee-friendly terms (e.g. 10yr exercise periods) that we explain to you as best as we can.
Great health, vision and dental insurance
Complementary OneMedical membership
401k plan, HSA plan (if selected), FSA plan (if selected)
Generous gym benefit (Equinox and equivalent)
Remote-friendly and WFH flexible
Security Benefits: Jumbo Pro, 1Password, VPN
Being a part of a fast-moving company in a really interesting space

Start date is ASAP. To apply (for now), please send your application to talent@jumboprivacy.com.
To be considered, you must be legally authorized to work in the US or possess independent work authorization.

Jumbo is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other basis determined by state or federal law.

Questions? Please reach out to us at talent@jumboprivacy.com and include your resume. We look forward to receiving and reviewing your application!

Job Description:
Job Description
The Corporate Strategy Team works like an internal consulting group partnering closely with the corporate, business unit, and functional leadership to solve business challenges and inform decision-making in the most critical, high-impact areas of the business. This leader will drive rapid strategy development for our client-facing business units and corporate functions. They will also lead transformative work like new product development, go-to-market strategies, digitization initiatives, organizational effectiveness, and business process redesign among others.
 The VP, Corporate Strategy would lead a team of Corporate Strategy associates that are working on the most important initiatives at the company. This role reports to ABM’s SVP, Strategy & Innovation, and presents a unique opportunity to work in close proximity to senior ABM leadership.
Responsibilities
Manage a team of corporate strategy associates who are executing on strategic initiatives aligned with the company’s recently launched five-year strategic vision
Execute and manage large, complicated strategy projects with multiple stakeholders, which involve strategy development, analysis, and planning for achieving business growth, performing business unit strategy development, and developing other strategic initiatives related to our team members, our clients, new products, and services
Develop content for executive-level presentations and reports to communicate and achieve buy-in for strategic recommendations
Design and facilitate various workshops and working sessions with ABM executives to build understanding and drive business outcomes
Develop a high degree of trust with key stakeholders to help manage relationships, engagement risks, and project economics including planning and budgeting
Work with key strategy stakeholder groups to build cross-functional relationships across the organization
Act as a counselor and coach, taking responsibility for developing the careers of junior team members, and leading staff recruitment and retention activities


Education, Required Skills & Competencies
10+ years of experience with a strategy/management consulting firm or strategic planning / corporate strategy group
Strong leadership and project management skills
Strategic, highly analytical thinker with sound business judgment and proven thought leadership
Self-starter who will work independently to drive projects forward within set objectives
Diverse problem-solving experience with the ability to contribute to solution development across a variety of functional areas
Proven ability to work on cross-functional teams in order to deliver business outcomes
Ability to flex between big picture thinking and sharp attention to detail
Well-tuned emotional intelligence
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to tailor for various functional areas and levels of management
Operates with a sense of urgency and transparency
Passion for contributing to large strategic initiatives

FULL REMOTE - Product Manager
If you are a FULL REMOTE - Product Manager with experience, please read on!
What You Need for this Position
3+ years experience with:
Experience in a client facing role, especially previous software development consulting / agency experienceA history of success managing multiple concurrent projects of varying complexity in multiple industries and at all stages of the product life-cycle, from greenfield/MVP products to mature products.Familiarity with current best practices in modern web and mobile design and development. Excellent skills in multi tasking, organizing, and prioritizing.
Excellent communication skills. You will need to be comfortable talking tech with developers, reviewing and offering feedback on designs with designers and clients, gathering product requirements from clients, handling customer feedback and distributing it back to the team.
What's In It for YouSalary: $130,000-160,000(DOE)401kHealth, Dental, VisionGenerous vacation policy
So, if you are a FULL REMOTE - Product Manager with experience, please apply today!

Job summary
At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer-centric company on earth. The goal of Amazon’s Delivery Service Partner (DSP) Management Team is to exceed the expectations of our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small, are delivered as quickly, accurately, and cost effectively as possible. To meet this goal, Amazon is continually striving to innovate and provide best in class delivery experience through the introduction of pioneering new products and services in the last mile delivery space. Come join the team and help us make history!

Amazon is seeking a disruptive builder to provide strategic leadership for Amazon’s current and future transportation initiatives. We are looking for a Manager, Business Development who will be responsible for leading a team that are responsible for the overall acquisition motion with delivery service partners (DSPs) as well as responsible for developing and nurturing external longer-term relationships with the business and entrepreneur communities in their area.

If you're a dynamic, organized leader who’s ready to partner with our Business Development team as they support the growth and scale of future DSPs in one of the fastest growing industries in the world, we’d like to talk with you. Curious? Good, that’s one of our Leadership Principles! Discover more about the opportunity below.

What You'll Do:
As a Manager, Business Development, you will lead a team of 3-6 Business Development Managers who each cultivate and recruit 50-100 future DSP owners assigned to delivery stations across the East region. The business development managers on your team will be responsible for the overall DSP acquisition funnel with DSPs. This includes ownership over a regional acquisition pipeline, from lead outreach to vetting and qualification. Our existing acquisition process is intentionally high touch and requires the business development manager to serve as an advisor so that both Amazon and the DSP candidate can evaluate fit.

Together, you’ll identify best-in-class future owners that will improve financial, operational, and safety practices across the Last Mile network. You’ll lead your team to collaborate with an integrated internal team of Marketing, Business Coaches, Capacity Planning, Station Operations Managers, and Program Managers to ensure owners launch and scale their business in compliance with program requirements. You’ll accomplish this by analyzing problems, discovering insights, delivering recommendations, and driving change both internally and externally.

What We Look For:
We seek customer-obsessed, detail-oriented individuals with a wide range of academic backgrounds, work experiences, and perspectives. A Manager, Business Development should have the curiosity to ask the right questions, the ability to collaborate with stakeholders, DSPs and team members, and the leadership to transform ideas into action. The right candidate will enjoy developing people and improving processes, leveraging data and analytics, assessing root causes, and providing insights to help drive strategy and best practices. Successful candidates:

Effectively hire, manage performance, coach and promote. Evangelize the Leadership Principles.
Use expertise and judgment to select stakeholders to determine the right goals, inform decisions, and design long-term solutions. Someone who can motivate and inspire others through encouragement, feedback and effective guidance.
Able to work and lead both tactically and strategically. Defines the strategy in sometimes ambiguous environment, influence and negotiate priorities with other teams, and determine where to simplify or extend solutions for the best outcome. Drives the use of best practices.
Able to handle complex problems/efforts, decisions, and escalations. Must be able to mitigate long-term risks and find a path forward in difficult situations.
Are highly organized and thrive in a dynamic environment with the ability to set and adjust priorities both independently and on behalf of their team.
Have exceptional written and verbal communication skills and the proven ability to build trust and develop relationships.
Must be able to work collaboratively in a team environment with various stakeholders and are comfortable managing by influence.
Can work effectively with people at all levels in an organization.

Key job responsibilities
You will lead and develop a team that consistently and effectively:

Develop recruiting and cultivation strategies based on local and regional DSP expansion plans.
Presenting our overall DSP program in front of groups, large and small, including a strong ability to answer complex questions on the fly.
Analyze key performance indicators to define and refine characteristics and criteria of high-quality future DSP owners.
Supporting owners as they onboard to the program and prepare to launch.
Identifying workflow inefficiencies and working to formulate and implement operational improvements at the network level and to improve the individual DSP owner experience.
Continuously engage, assess, and train our vetted future DSPs to enable and improve future owner fit and success.
9+ of relevant work experience in business development, public relations, recruiting or retail/vendor/supplier management.
MBA or other advanced graduate degree.
SQL experience.
Last Mile, Operations, and/or small parcel packaging experience.
Experience working with or owning a small business.
Demonstrated strong leadership skills when confronted with difficult situations exhibiting ability to keep the team focused and motivated.
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills, particularly in delivering constructive feedback and working through complex issues.
Strong interpersonal skills and experience managing and developing relationships.
Willingness to travel (~2-3 days/week); the role is based out of our NYC office (JFK25), but the Candidate must be flexible with hours and travel to support the Business Development Managers and their portfolio of assigned future DSP owners as needed.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

job_description:
Community Options, Inc. is a national non-profit agency providing services to individuals with disabilities in 10 states.
We are seeking a Full-Time TBI Waiver Service Coordinator in Manhattan NY.
The TBI Service Coordinator uses best practices and technology within a community based setting to assist, train and supervise individuals in activities of daily living and socialization skills. Using discretion and independent judgement, the Service Coordinator coordinates and monitors the assessment and treatment planning process; the delivery and follow-up of patient care; and assures that the appropriate service plans are followed. This individual also serves as an advocate and liaison for and on their behalf.
Responsibilities:
Develops Service Plans and ensures consumer assessments are completed to determine if goals and objectives are being met.
Gathers the necessary information for the applicant to be approved as a waiver participant.
Secures a residence in the community that meets the individual’s welfare and safety needs.
Creates and implements the service plan, making revisions every six months.
Supports and encourages the waiver participant to increase his/her ability to problem solve, be in control of life situations, and be as independent as possible.
Identifies, develops, and coordinates community resources and support.
Maintains all documentation of service delivery and billing.
Assures that the assessment of need for a nursing facility level of care will be initiated on the anniversary of the initial determination (PRI/Screen).
Initiates a re-evaluation of the level of care when the waiver participant has experienced a significant improvement in his/her ability to function independently in the community.
Communicates and documents employee’s progress to the employer and support people, including family, residential staff and other professionals.
Experience/Skills:
Master’s degree with one year or practical experience as a case manager working with people with disabilities
OR Bachelor’s degree with two years of practical experience as a case manager working with individuals with disabilities.
OR Associates Degree, with three years of practical experience as a case manager working with individuals with disabilities.
Successful completion of required training.
Flexibility to deal with people at a variety of levels, both internally and externally.
Ability to present facts and recommendations effectively in oral and written form.
Excellent crisis and time management skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to establish a comfortable and supportive relationship with a person receiving supports.
Able to meet deadlines to ensure participants continued eligibility in the waiver program.
Ability to lift 50 pounds (weight of average manual wheelchair when chair is empty).
Licenses/Certificates:
TBI and NHTD overview Training
Community Options, Inc. orientation.
Valid driver's license and good driving record.
If interested, please click apply now or send resume to: Gabrielle.Schapira@comop.org
Community Options is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
