Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from ViacomCBS, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream ViacomCBS Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.

Overview
We are looking for an SVP of Program Marketing to own the team responsible for developing go-to-market strategy and coordinated 360 marketing campaigns for Paramount+ sports and news programming. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional leads in defining the overall strategic and creative framework, as well as tactical levers all while coordinating outstanding campaign execution. Come join our team!

Responsibilities

Subscriber acquisition marketing:
Manage a team developing innovative go-to-market cross-channel launch campaigns for sports and news content on Paramount+
Plan and coordinate execution of 360 campaigns to drive subscriber growth across direct-to-consumer online and offline marketing channels including, own site and platforms, email, performance marketing, activations, and more.
Develop new ideas to drive growth and elevate the Paramount+ brand. Strive to continuously improve KPI metrics across key sources of business.
Collaborate closely with product development team to launch, integrate, and customize originals campaigns within the core product.
Partnership with CBS Sports and CBS News business leadership to drive cross platform and in-show content promotion optimization and content programming as promotion
Develop strategies to optimize the sports and news audience funnel driving free to pay.
Develop partnerships and relationships with leagues, clubs and teams for promotion.

Forecasting and Expense Management:
Responsible for sports and news categories in the marketing budget planning and subscriber forecasting working closely with finance and media planning teams.
Analysis and Process Improvement
Partner with Business Intelligence, Research and Marketing Operations team to develop, update and improve reporting that tracks KPIs and business metrics to uncover concrete trends, consumer insights and forecasts.
Develop and maintain processes and workflow to ensure a high-functioning group

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree required
15+ years of entertainment marketing experience with the ability to drive awareness, interest and viewing for sports and news content
Strong understanding of the media landscape, and experience with paid media planning and execution across all verticals; experience with DTC and streaming products a plus
Extensive experience making strategic decisions in real-time, including developing strategy, positioning and targeting audiences based on qualitative and quantitative research; analyzing campaign performance data and optimizing accordingly
Concordant record of building, leading and developing hard-working teams
Experience affiliation directly with talent, producers, and showrunners on campaign marketing
Excellent writing, communication, and interpersonal skills
Strong presentation skills

Additional Qualifications
Shown ability to meet deadlines with an exceptional attention to detail.
A positive attitude and the ability to thrive in a collaborative, yet fast-paced work environment
Passionate about all things pop culture and entertainment!
Excellent sense of humor

Reports to: Chief Development and Marketing Officer

Organization Summary: United Way of New York City (UWNYC) is a nonprofit mobilizing people and organizations to eradicate barriers and create opportunities that improve the lives of low-income New Yorkers. Part of the United Way Worldwide system, one of the world's most recognized charitable brands, we envision caring communities in which all individuals and families have access to quality education and the opportunity to lead healthy and financially secure lives. We strive to model our values in all our relationships, both internal and external: Collaboration, Compassion, Integrity, Accountability, and Superior Performance.

Position Overview: The Director, Corporate Social Responsibility, reports to the Chief Development and Marketing Officer and serves a critical role as a cross-departmental leader, ensuring internal and external stakeholder needs are aligned, while maximizing corporate financial support and community impact. This role will focus on the development, implementation, and execution of strategic partnership plans including, but not limited to, employee volunteerism, professional development, and individual/corporate giving. Constant evaluation is also critical in this role. This role may also have the support of a Corporate Engagement associate in partnership with the Director, Corporate Engagement.

Primary Responsibilities:

Cross-Departmental Leadership – 30%

Work directly with Volunteerism and Community Impact teams to identify nonprofit partner needs and create corresponding volunteer opportunities for corporate partners and individual employees.
Serve as project manager of a cross-functional team focused on strategic planning and implementation of a Corporate Volunteerism Equity Learning Journey
In partnership with the Individual Giving team & Director, Corporate Engagement, build strategies to support the growth of partner affinity groups and UWNYC affinity networks (including Development cabinets) with a focus on D&I and UWNYC’s Campaign for Equity.
Ensure all groups are given the tools that they need to support UWNYC’s mission.
Serve as the Resource Development POD liaison for one of the UWNYC Programmatic Pillars to ensure the continued development of impact products, ongoing learning, and continuous improvement.
Support the development of communication strategies and processes aimed at sharing community impact stories, statistics, etc. with corporate and individual donors.
Support Director, Corporate Engagement in the development of campaign assets, talking points, and other external-facing materials.
Strategic Partnership Management – 40%

Support the creation and management of customized corporate partnerships focusing on giving, employee engagement/professional development, and volunteerism tailored to the corporate partner’s values, and core strengths, as well as the needs of the community.
Work with the Strategic Initiatives team to maximize opportunities to obtain and renew corporate foundation support.
In partnership with the Director, Corporate Engagement, support the recruitment, management, and retainment of strategic new business accounts.
Increase overall corporate revenue through strategic partnerships and year-round engagement.

Research & Development – 30%

In partnership with the Sr. Director, Culture and Organizational Development, redefine and redevelop (Diagnose, Design, and Deploy) the overall CSR framework for external corporate partners based on key trends and stakeholder needs.
Establish and constantly reevaluate (Drive) KPIs for the updated CSR framework
Strategize and research innovative ways to partner and grow corporate financial support & engagement through programmatic investments, in-kind contributions, program-specific giving campaigns, and other collaborative efforts.
Research viability of creation of a CSR council consisting of UWNYC partners

Skills, Knowledge & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree required
5 - 7 years’ experience holding progressively responsible positions in nonprofit development, foundation giving, corporate philanthropy, or managing senior-level business-to-business sales accounts
Astute listener and able to understand, reflect, and incorporate what clients’ and peers’ needs and interests are
Ability to bring together various stakeholders toward a common goal
Excellent writing, editing, verbal, presentation, and public speaking skills
Effective at engaging with top-level corporate executives
Deep understanding of the corporate landscape and next-generation workforce of New York City
Adept at translating program partnerships and outcomes in order to communicate UWNYC’s value in the community and build a case for member support
Innovative thinker, with a track record for translating strategic thinking into action plans and results
Excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills
Presence and confidence to project credibility to donors and peers
Ability to handle multiple projects and quickly “change gears” as needed
Familiarity with database and CRM tools
A passion for UWNYC’s mission, vision, and accomplishments
This is a visionary role and will require constant evaluation and cross-department communication and collaboration.

Key Competencies:

Drives Revenue
High degree of accountability
Strategic Relationship Building
Effective and Engaging Communicator
Embracing and Managing Change
Entrepreneurial and Innovative
Critical Thinking and Creative Problem Solving

Additional Requirement:

Fully vaccinated for Covid-19

How to apply:

Please send a cover letter with salary requirements and resume to resume@uwnyc.org with the title " Director, Corporate Social Responsibility" in the subject line. No phone calls or faxes accepted.

Overview:
CAREPOINT HEALTH
Company Overview:
CarePoint Health is one of New Jersey’s leading health care systems comprised of three long-standing and highly-regarded hospitals – Christ Hospital in Jersey City, Hoboken University Medical Center and Bayonne Medical Center. CarePoint united three area hospitals to provide 360-degree-coordinated care by integrating the medical facilities and physician networks associated with these institutions. With over 4,500 employees, CarePoint is the largest private employer in Hudson County, New Jersey and each year provides care to over 300,000 individuals.
CarePoint prides itself on its patient-focused approach to care delivery, with an emphasis on preventative medicine, health education, and disease management. Leveraging its vast network of physicians and healthcare experts, CarePoint is quickly becoming recognized as a leader in the broader healthcare landscape as it pioneers creative solutions to address urgent population health needs.
Responsibilities:
MAIN FUNCTIONS:
The Assistant General Counsel is responsible for advising on a wide variety of legal matters, including but not limited to contract drafting and negotiation, employment agreements, medical staff matters, patient care issues, litigation, risk management and compliance. The Assistant General Counsel will:
Provide support to designated areas of the system on legal issues, including review of likely or pending litigation matters, providing legal advice to management and staff, and drafting and reviewing policy revisions in conformity with statutory and regulatory requirements
Researching a broad range of laws and regulations affecting the system, including federal and state laws and regulations affecting the licensing, certification and operation of healthcare facilities; Medicare and Medicaid, Stark Law, Anti-Kickback law, and antitrust issues; procurement; corporate compliance (including conflict of interest); and risk management.
Draft, negotiate and review contracts and related documents, including for the provision of health care related services, procurement of goods and services, affiliation agreements, physician employment and services, leases of space and property, confidentiality of patient and proprietary information, intellectual property, and data sharing.
Provide general legal advice to the system’s affiliated entities, senior management, medical staff leadership and employees on a wide variety of legal matters related to operational issues, including patient-related situations.
Qualifications:
EDUCATION:
D. from an accredited institution
Admitted to the practice of law in at least one state of the United States, preferably New Jersey
EXPERIENCE:
Three to five years of law firm or in-house counsel experience, primarily in the practice of health law
QUALIFICATIONS:
Demonstrated commitment to excellence in the provision of legal advice
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills
Ability to work effectively in a high-pressured and fast-paced environment
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to demonstrate flexibility handling multiple projects, both large and small, while maintaining a high level of detail-orientation
Fluent in Microsoft Office suite of applications, e.g. Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint

With over 4,500 employees, CarePoint is the largest private employer in Hudson County, New Jersey and each year provides care to over 300,000 individuals.CarePoint prides itself on its patient-focused approach to care delivery, with an emphasis on preventative medicine, health education, and disease management. Leveraging its vast network of physicians and healthcare experts, CarePoint is quickly becoming recognized as a leader in the broader healthcare landscape as it pioneers creative solutions to address urgent population health needs.MAIN FUNCTIONS:The Physician Liaison will help to develop and implement the growth strategy for CarePoint Health within its target markets. As a key member of the Business Development team, the Physician Liaison will provide services related to expanding provider networks, supporting existing practices within the medical group, cultivating, and supporting new service lines, and fostering excellent marketing and public relations with community physicians.Develop and implement marketing strategies and promotional activities.Meets with key referral physicians and other identified target audiences to educate them on services, physicians, capabilities, etc.Research, develop and implement strategies and tactics to increase volume in key clinical areas.Work to understand the needs of each department and ensure growth.Troubleshoot any issues that may arise and rectify all in a timely and professional manner.Create, foster, and enhance Physician relationships.Properly document, prepare and maintain files with extreme confidentiality.Provide recommendations to standardize policies and procedures to support medical staff functions.Assure regulatory compliance of medical staff standard.Recognize, investigate, and validate discrepancies and adverse information obtained.Organize and promote educational programs, social events, professional meetings, and other activities as needs are identified.Develop and maintain a database that tracks client account management records and sales/communication effortsEDUCATION:Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience in Healthcare Marketing, Business Development or Physician Practice development required, Master's Degree a plus.EXPERIENCE:Experience in healthcare required.2-4 years of Business to Business (B2B) Development or sales marketing experience. .QUALIFICATIONS:Ability to manage time effectively; manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.Attention to detail and outstanding work ethicJob Type: Full-timeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Doctorate (Preferred)License/Certification:BC/BE (Preferred)Medical License (Preferred)Willingness to travel:25% (Preferred)Work Location: One location

Job Title: Deputy Fire & Life Safety Director

Employment Type: Full-time

Reports To: Fire & Life Safety Director


Job Description

The Deputy Fire & Life Safety Director reports to the Fire & Life Safety Director and must be capable of performing the duties of the Fire & Life Safety Director in his /her absence. The responsibility involves all aspect of life safety. The Deputy Fire & Life Safety Director while on duty will represent Barclays Center with the utmost professional and business-like manner at all times.


Duties & Responsibilities:

Operating and maintenance of the Fire Alarm System and all related equipment; maintaining the general condition of the Fire Command Center. Generating, filing and distributing accurate incident reports and investigating all incidents. Preparing and submitting detailed incident reports to the Life Safety/Security.
Reviewing all daily log entries regarding fire prevention and maintaining Fire Department Logbooks as specified by Local Law No.5 & 26; to ensure that proper procedures are being followed.
Assist FDNY personnel with inspections.
Capable of training all Fire Wardens, Deputy Fire Wardens, Searchers, and Building Fire Brigade; manage the Fire Wardens/Deputy Wardens sign-in logs and Organization Charts; schedule and conduct all building Fire/EAP drills; direct evacuation procedures.
Conduct monthly communication testing of the Fire Alarm System with central station; conduct semi-annual testing of the Fire Alarm System signaling and initiating devices per code; conduct daily inspection of the building for fire prevention and protection; conduct all inspections and testing whether per NYC code or company policy.
Follows all posted orders as assigned. Monitoring computerized Access Control, CCTV Systems and responding to intrusion and Hold-Up (panic) alarms. Monitoring and responding to the Building Intercom System. Remain aware and alert at all times to potential security breaches.
Must be available afternoons, nights & overnights (Sunday - Saturday). Works daily assigned shift (40hrs per week).
Provide pertinent information to the Fire Department during emergencies and routine visits/inspections maintenance of all Fire Extinguishers systems; conduct the monthly Elevator Recall Phase I and Firemen Service Phase II. Monthly inspection of portable Fire Extinguishers.
Enforcement of all security and life safety policies, rules and procedures, which are set forth by Building Management & Tenant. Processing and accessing tenants and visitors into the building daily, this includes validating of ID cards and recording the information on sign-in sheets and issuing building passes
Providing clear direction, information and assistance to client visitors, guests, vendors and employees in a professional, pleasant and courteous fashion on a regular basis and during emergency situations.


Required Qualifications (Job Knowledge, Skills, and Education):

A high school diploma, GED or equivalent is required.
In addition, Security Guard License and FDNY Cert. T-89, F-89, S-95 with Active Shooter & Medical Emergency Preparedness is required
In addition to the education outlined above, at least 3-5 years of progressively responsible experience in related field is required
Must have good verbal/written communication skills, strong customer service, and analytical skills. Computer knowledge of W2000, XP, Microsoft Office Word and Microsoft Office Excel.
Problem solving, customer service, oral communication, teamwork, diversity, ethics treats people with respect.
Follows policy and procedure, planning, organizing prioritizes work efficiently. Professionalism, react well under pressure.
Dependability follows instructions, responds to management direction and takes responsibility for own actions.

Come join The Woodhouse Day Spas, voted America’s best day spa many years in a row. We are hiring for Full Time or Part Time Spa Concierges.


At the Woodhouse, we value our team members and strive for excellence with every guest experience. Share with us your unique talents and professionalism and in return, we will train you “The Woodhouse Way” providing you with all the tools, knowledge, and intention that will

help you deliver the best guest experience each and every time.


We are a company that recognizes rewards and celebrates with you along the way…as you

excel and grow in your talents opportunities will follow you. The Woodhouse is the leader in affordable luxury. The willingness to serve and the ability to deliver are at the core of our company’s mantra. We are seeking passion filled, enthusiastic individuals driven to serve others. Our Spa Concierges:


Provides personal attention from the time the guest walks through the door

Strength Through Diversity
Ground breaking science. Advancing medicine. Healing made personal.
Roles & Responsibilities:
1. Maintains an accurate, current census, including cassette bin labels, for all assigned areas.
2. Maintains adequate inventory at all times, such as medications, intravenous supplies. Maintains stock of satellites, automated dispensing machines, urgent stock.
3. Returns reusable medications to stock before the end of the shift, including processing of controlled substance returns.
4. Prepares medications and puts into cassettes, automated dispensing, urgent stock; these medications must be checked by a pharmacist. Accurately fills these medication needs and performs statistical count of all doses when needed.
5. Exchanges cassettes/patient-specific bins per schedule established by management.
6. Assists in exchange of crash cart trays and auxiliary stock.
7. Conducts all required deliveries and other patient care area rounds in a timely fashion as directed by management.
8. Repackages medications as per departmental policy.
9. Prepares parenteral products under the direct supervision of a pharmacist, after appropriate training. This may include reconstitution of medications with appropriate diluents and adding to infusion bags using aseptic technique, defrosting frozen medications, and wasting of needles/equipment. May be responsible for preparing laminar flow hoods, operating repeater pumps, etc.
10. Prepares labels and affixes to product as required. Prepares medications for review by a pharmacist.
11. Obtains required signatures when delivering/provisioning controlled substances, prescription pads.
12. Performs inspections of pharmacy, nursing unit and/or clinic locations. Checking of refrigerator temperature and documentation therein.
13. Routinely checks for and removes expired medications from inventory.
14. Completes all required documentation and maintains records.
15. Completes audits of controlled substances as directed.
16. Assists in reporting and resolving controlled substance discrepancies.
17. Assists in quality control projects as assigned within the department.
18. Effective communication with nursing and other services in person and via telecommunications.
19. Maintains work environment in a clean, neat and orderly fashion.
20. Conducts all required functions under the direct supervision of a registered pharmacist.
21. Under the supervision of a pharmacist and after appropriate training, obtains medication information/history from patients and/or their caregiver for input into the electronic medical record..
Requirements:

Requirements for Position
High School graduate or equivalent.
Successful completion of a technician training program, or equivalent experience (as determined by the Director).
Name: Certified Pharmacy Tech (CPhT) required Issuing Agency: PTCB or NHA
Name: Registered Pharmacy Technician Issuing Agency: NYS Board of Pharmacy
Moderate Physical Activity (e.g., occasional to prolonged standing, lifting, bending, filing, typing, etc.)
Strength Through Diversity
The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity and inclusion is a driver for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Yet we’re as diverse as the city we call home- culturally, ethically, in outlook and lifestyle. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai’s unrivaled record of achievement, education and advancement as we revolutionize healthcare delivery together.
We work hard to recruit and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you have the opportunity and support to develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, have an impact on quality patient care.
Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story!
Who We Are
Over 38,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve.
Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospitals, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai Morningside ( Formerly St Luke’s), and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai.
The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate, exclude, or treat people differently on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.

job_description:
We are seeking a Business Planning & Operations Lead to support our Content Strategy & Acquisitions (CS&A) team at Meta. This role will support leaders in the CS&A team in defining business goals, navigating operational decisions, strengthening organizational design, collaborating in a seamless way with a wide range of stakeholders, and conducting a variety of ad hoc projects and analyses. This role will also partner closely with a range of cross-functional stakeholders, including analytics, marketing, finance, HR, product and more.The ideal candidate will be a versatile problem solver who can transcend reporting lines, bring teams together, and execute.


Collaborate with key leaders on annual planning, resource planning, goal-setting, and a wide range of special projects
Identify, prioritize, and solve complex business challenges, with an eye to strengthening how the team operates over time
Map out the network of cross-functional stakeholders spanning across Meta, and set up a structured approach to aligning teams under a common set of objectives
Lead operational reviews on a monthly/quarterly basis in order to drive decision-making
Support leadership meetings and facilitate alignment on key issues and opportunities


4+ years of experience in strategic planning and/or business operations in the technology/internet/media space or relevant industry
Proven experience weaving quantitative and qualitative analysis into a compelling narrative
Proven communication skills, including experience synthesizing a complex message into a presentation for stakeholders or leaders


Experience in corporate strategy, consulting, business strategy, business operations, or finance
Direct experience in the content or music industry with exposure to content acquisition
Track record of leading complex projects from defining the problem through to executing the solution
Track record of increasing scope and responsibility

job_description:
Job Title: Human Resources Generalist

Employment Type: Full-time

Reports To: Sr. Director, Human Resources


Job Description

This position is responsible for the day-to-day operation, activities and functions of the Human Resources Department including input on the HR portion of the overall business strategy involving recruitment, on boarding, HRIS, labor and employee relations, benefits, audit reporting, payroll, training, employee development and Workers' Compensation.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Administers human resources policies, programs, and practices. Ensures compliance with federal, state and local labor laws to reduce potential for litigation Select, train, motivate and evaluate staff; provide or coordinate staff training; work with employees to correct deficiencies; implement discipline and termination procedures.
Manages recruitment process including interviewing, hiring, and applicant processing. Develops, integrates, and compiles diversity strategies, goals, and reporting.
Represents Company at external Job Fairs, networking, and speaking engagements
Conducts new hire orientation and training for employees
Oversees compensation program and makes recommendations to senior management on payroll adjustments, bonuses, etc. Ensures all payroll adjustments, bonuses, etc. are accurately processed in a timely manner and according to contract terms. Oversees and makes recommendations for the performance/merit review process.
Processes and monitors Unemployment and Workers' Compensation claims, attending hearings as necessary as well as responding to claims filed by City, State and Federal Agencies such as EEOC and Wage and Hour.
Oversees or processes payroll for union and non-union hourly employees. Approves and processes time off requests, contractual increases, and union employer benefit contributions.
Oversees the maintenance of personnel/medical files, I-9 and background check files.
Assists with provision of information required for labor negotiations and union grievances.
Builds solid relationships with Directors and Managers at all levels. Advises Managers on effective coaching and counseling and assists with conflict resolution documentation and delivery of corrective action.
Prepares all necessary termination paperwork and ensures HR has representation in termination meetings.
Oversees preparation, maintenance and calculation of all labor accruals and staffing reconciliation for payroll accounting; calculates and records GL entries for union benefits and ensures accuracy of data.
Maintains a presence with employees by attending pre-shift and department meetings as well as events.
Oversees the planning and coordination of employee communications, events and reward & recognition programs.
Develops and manages HR budget.


Required Qualifications (Job Knowledge, Skills, and Education):

A minimum education level of: BA/BS Degree (4-year, Area of Study: Human Resources or IO Psychology)
A minimum of 2-4 years of related work experience
Excellent verbal, written, listening and public relations skills
Demonstrated ability to forge strong, trusting relationships with management
Excellent customer service skills working with diverse backgrounds
Must possess and exude a positive, team-oriented attitude
Ability to prioritize projects and tasks while remaining productive and professional
Self-starter with a willingness and enthusiasm for taking on additional responsibility
Creative and detail oriented, organized and capable of meeting established deadlines
Independent thinking and problem solving capabilities
Demonstrated knowledge of and success with conflict management and resolution
Knowledge of federal, state and local employee laws and regulations
Ability to work flexible schedule including nights, weekends and holidays
Prior supervisory experience preferred with aptitude for mentoring and developing staff
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $35 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.
The Staff Program Manager role is part of the Laboratory Products Division (LPD) which unites deep scientific expertise, a collaborative culture and rich resources to deliver the lab equipment and consumables that our customers need to achieve their scientific goals – quickly, reliably and safely. Our smart lab solutions make it faster and easier for our customers to focus on what matters most – delivering answers and innovations that save and improve lives. This position will be based out of our Rochester, NY facility. Remote option is available.
How will you make an impact?
The position of Staff Program Manager provides an exciting opportunity for an experienced, highly motivated individual. The successful candidate will be expected to demonstrate exceptional facilitation, organizational, communication, and influencing skills.
You will lead collaborative cross-functional teams to define and deliver commitments: demonstrating feasibility for new technologies, commercializing new products, or improving on-market products, all using our stage-gate or iterative processes to deliver to the agreed scope, schedule, and budget, while managing execution, risks, trade-offs, expectations, and communications.
What will you do?
Leads project core teams.
Collaborates with team members to develop detailed project plans (scope, milestones, roles & responsibilities, timing, budget, communication and interfaces with any external alliance or collaborator partner organizations, etc.)
Oversees and prepares project team budget including resources and costs, collaborating with Finance and other cross-functional departments.
Communicates, documents and archives project team activities and decisions.
Acts as primary contact for project team related information.
Facilitates project team meetings, cross-functional communication and decision making, ensuring alignment with internal and external stakeholders.
Manages projects within established scope, schedule, resources and budget.
Identifies any program-related issues, concerns or challenges proactively.
Facilitates tradeoff decisions and removes obstacles.
Conducts proactive risk management: communication of needs, mitigation plans, and requirements relevant to internal/external stakeholders.
Reviews project team progress regularly and uses processes, tools and other related resources to ensure effective team dynamics and decision-making, as well as effective interactions with all internal and external collaborators
How will you get here?
Education/ Experience:
Bachelor’s degree required.
2+ years of professional experience required
Previous cross-functional project management experience required
Project Management Institute (PMI) Certification preferred
Agile or waterfall experience preferred
New product or platform development / introduction preferred
Lean / Process improvement preferred
Management of concerns and conflicts productively and effectively within core and extended teams.
Comfort with ambiguity and uncertainty.
Results and detail-oriented; self-motivated.
Outstanding orientation to teamwork: works collaboratively.
Proficient with project management principles (e.g., resource allocation, cost estimation, risks analysis).
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to effectively articulate complex concepts and ideas to broad audiences.
Strong influencing skills; proven ability to get things done without formal authority.
Strong negotiation skills; can effectively drive discussions and decisions toward desired results.
Problem solving skills.
Exceptional ability to organize.
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project).
Proficient with project management tools and applications software to manage complex project timelines and resources.
Ability to travel up to 15%, primarily within the United States
Our global team of more than 90,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com

Minimum Qualifications
3 years of experience in content strategy
Bachelor's degree in English, journalism, marketing or a related field
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills
Understanding of SEO best practices
Proficiency in UX writing and information architecture
Proficiency in giving writing feedback
Preferred Qualifications
4 years of experience in content strategy

Job Summary
The UX Content Strategist creates and implements strategies that define how and when to communicate with the user. They use the brand's voice and tone guidelines to ensure content is consistent throughout the product's life cycle and aligns with user needs and business goals. They collaborate with content creators throughout the business to unify experiences and allow clients to achieve their most incredible financial goals.
Responsibilities
Create and maintain content inventories and journey maps
Establish governance plans, including workflows and audit criteria
Conduct audits to analyze existing content and identify gaps
Develop workflows to guide efficient content creation and publishing
Develop information architecture strategies, including taxonomies and content models
Create style guides and message hierarchies that drive content creation across the client experience
Present strategies and recommendations to stakeholders and content creators, using expertise and persuasion to influence the product vision and design
Test and analyze content to identify areas for improvement
Establish content libraries to encourage content reuse and standardization
Who We Are
Detroit-based Rocket Companies® is a family of businesses providing simple, fast and trusted digital solutions for complex transactions. The name comes from our flagship business, Rocket Mortgage®, which was founded in 1985. Today, we're a publicly traded company involved in several different industries, including mortgages, fintech, real estate, automotive and more. We're insistently different in how we look at the world and committed to an inclusive workplace where every voice is heard. We're passionate about the work we do, and it shows. We've been ranked #5 on Fortune's list of the 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2021, as well as ranking #1 for Fortune's Best Large Workplaces in Financial Services and Insurance List in 2021.

Job Title: Sanctions & Embargoes Advisory, Policy & Governance
Corporate Title: Assistant Vice President
Location: New York, NY
Overview
The sanctions and embargoes program is aimed to ensure that Deutsche Bank and its staff fully comply with all applicable sanctions and embargoes. For this purpose, the Bank established a global organization with dedicated rights and responsibilities. The sanctions and embargoes program has been implemented globally and throughout all business divisions via the Embargo Policy and the Special Risk Country Policy. This role is responsible for the provision of advice for business and infrastructure functions on compliance with sanctions and embargoes regulations and respective policies.
What We Offer You:
We offer competitive health and wellness benefits, empowering you to value life in and out of the office
Retirement savings plans, parental leave, and other family-friendly programs
An environment that encourages networking and collaboration across functions and businesses
Active engagement with the local community through Deutsche Bank’s specialized employee groups
Return to Office:
At this time, all individuals present in the location must be fully vaccinated for Covid-19
It is the Bank’s expectation that employees hired into this role will work in the New York office in accordance with the Bank’s hybrid working model
Deutsche Bank provides reasonable accommodations to candidates and employees with a substantiated need based on disability and/or religion
Hear from our people and look inside our office: DB@The Muse
Your Key Responsibilities:
Support the Americas Regional Head of Sanctions and the Deputy Regional Head of Sanctions in protecting the Bank from legal, regulatory, and reputational risk regarding business involving sanctioned entities and/or countries
Provide guidance regarding embargo-related questions and issues thereby supporting the Business to establish organizational and controlling structures suitable to carry out intended transactions in well-defined compliance environment
Support in the translation of external developments of the legal situation into potential policy adjustments for the Bank
Ensure diligent review of transaction-related requests and decide on these in full compliance with all applicable sanctions regulations as well as the Bank's policies and procedures; escalate to the Global Head of Sanctions as required
Review/decide on the adoption of new clients/review of existing clients that are referred to the Regional Head of Sanctions; escalate to the global level as required
Support sanctions-relevant reporting obligations involving countries in the region to the competent authorities; handle and respond to inquiries from regulatory authorities as well as internal or external auditors and business lines regarding embargo and sanctions observance
Your Skills and Experience:
BA/BS required, JD/Masters preferred, relevant experience in AML or sanctions compliance and operations in a global financial institution highly desirable
Proficiency Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Extensive experience in financial services or similar industry in compliance, legal, or project management function, working with policies and procedures, group governance and/or organizational management
Ability to work across geographic and cultural boundaries to achieve organizational goals & objectives, ability to deliver timely and quality execution in a fast-paced and high-pressured environment, and flexibility to work extended hours to meet deadlines, when necessary
Excellent writing and communication skills combined with strong drafting, analytical, and communication skills
Our values define the working environment we strive to create - diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

Job: Restaurant Manager

Job Details:
We are actively seeking passionate food and beverage professionals for an exciting opportunity to work at a high-end private dining club in Midtown. The right candidate is one who is professionally driven, sincere in their spirit of hospitality, and otherwise treats their guests, their workplace, and their fellow team members with abundant respect and positivity.

The successful candidate will be performing the dual functions of Floor Manager and Sommelier/Cellar Master/Beverage Program support.

Requirements:
A minimum of 2 years fine-dining restaurant experience as Manager.
Wine Degree/Certification(s) a distinct advantage. In lieu of certification, solid French, Italian, and domestic wine knowledge are acceptable.
Must be wholeheartedly interested in growing and utilizing managerial skills as the complementary counterpart to a well-rounded restaurant industry professional. This job is not your usual one-or-the-other wine or management role, it is both.
A hospitable and approachable demeanor combined with impeccable service standards, clean work habits, and keen attention to detail.
A "lead by example", roll up your sleeves and get things done mentality.
An ability to multitask in a high-volume environment while always maintaining a spirit of same-side teamwork.
A professional and polished appearance, combined with the ability to interact with all types of team members and build relationships with guests.
Must be comfortable performing both hands-on service/service supervision as well as administrative tasks in response to the needs of the operation.
Must always perform one's job with effective personal time management in mind so that all tasks are completed on schedule.
Must always seek to resolve challenges with positive, solution-minded thinking.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be able to work a flexible schedule, consisting of but not limited to late nights, weekends and holidays.
Must have computer knowledge of basic restaurant systems and POS systems, including Word and Excel.

Perks:
Health Insurance
Dental Insurance
Paid Vacation
Compensation: Salary (based on experience).

If you are a highly motivated candidate looking to further your career in the hospitality industry, and you have a passion for fine food and beverage, we would love to hear from you.

Please send your resume with a cover letter and include a quick note in the body of the email that specifies your available start date.

Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with other experts in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?
Want to make an impact that matters? Consider Deloitte Global.
Work you'll do:
In this interesting and diverse role, you’ll gain exposure to firm leaders throughout the globe and gain a deep knowledge of our 5 businesses (Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, and Tax & Legal). As a Manager, you will lead a small team helping to solve complex business issues from shaping and strategy to execution, with oversight from a Senior Manager or Director. Examples of impactful work include:
Engaging with senior firm leaders to shape and prioritize their innovation objectives and collaborate across businesses, geographies, and/or enabling areas to execute toward defined innovation objectives
Helping shape future firm offerings by identifying emerging trends, white-space opportunities for the firm, and building new programs within identified offerings
Accelerating the way the firm goes to market as a technology-enabled services business by designing global processes for the technology development lifecycle, implementing technology platforms to enable those processes, and building certification programs to help standardize how innovative products are built and taken to market

What you'll be part of - our Deloitte Global Culture:
At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and implement global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network.

In Deloitte Global, everyone has opportunities. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark.
Who you'll work with:
In Deloitte Global Strategy & Innovation, we make an impact by creating cutting-edge market-ready solutions for our Deloitte organization. We offer pioneering technology and methodology practices that reshape our environments, businesses, and connect people in fresh and exciting ways.
How you'll grow:
Deloitte Global inspires our people at every level. We believe in investing in you, helping you at every step of your career, and helping you identify and hone your unique strengths. We encourage you to grow by providing formal and informal development programs, coaching, and mentoring. We want you to ask questions, take chances, and explore the possible.

Benefits you'll receive:

Deloitte’s Total Rewards program reflects our continued commitment to lead from the front in everything we do — that’s why we take pride in offering a comprehensive variety of programs and resources to support your health and well-being needs. We provide the benefits, competitive compensation, and recognition to help sustain your efforts in making an impact that matters.
Corporate Citizenship:
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people, and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.

Required:
Minimum 5 years* of experience in any of the following
Commercial technology consulting experience
Technology organization
Digital product development, digital enterprise product design, development and deployment, artificial intelligence, cloud, blockchain, robotic process automation, cybersecurity and other disruptive technologies
Bachelor’s degree in a technology field
Self-starter and continuous learner – willing to research and acquire new skills to get the job done
Critical and “out-of-the-box” thinker – questions the status-quo while coming up with innovative solutions
Resourceful – leverages network, internal and external resources to inform and educate the project
Analytical – grasps complex concepts and synthesizes unstructured data to summarize effectively and drive key decisions.
Comfortable with ambiguity and pivoting priorities
Executive presence and communication skills – able to build executive-level presentations and present to an executive audience
Delivers to results - able to develop and articulate a point of view on key global trends and how they impact clients
Experience influencing others (small team of direct reports, key stakeholders, etc.)

Other Qualifications:
Bonus:
Post-graduate study or degree (*then only 3 years of experience in above is required)
Comfortable with Microsoft Suite
Interest in disruptive technologies and innovative trends
High attention to detail
Experience managing or working autonomously, and collaborating across multiple time zones with a global virtual team

The responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to perform most tasks related to the credentialing of new providers, including document collection and verification, and provider credentialing file maintenance. Also ensure that all credentialing supporting documentation is confidential and maintained in a secure environment. As well as assisting facilities and providers in understanding and adhering to MetroPlus’ policies and procedures regarding the credentialing process. Key Responsibilities: 1. Maintain communication with the credentialing contacts at facilities and provider sites to coordinate receipt of information required for credentialing, re-credentialing, and update of provider credentialing information 2. Review provider-credentialing file for completion and presentation to the Credentialing Committee 3. Perform primary source verification on required elements and in accordance with MetroPlus’ policies and procedures 4. Data entry and upkeep of provider information in the credentialing database 5. Verify New York State OPMC and Medicare/Medicaid for any current sanctions, restrictions on licensure and/or limitations on the scope of practice on all credentialed providers in interim credentialing periods 6. Generate and disseminate monthly provider credentialing updates to appropriate departments at MetroPlus Health Plan and participating facilities and providers 7. Create, copy, file, and maintain all relevant documentation into provider credentialing folder 8. Perform annual delegated file audits and participate in pre-delegation and delegation site reviews 9. Respond to inquiries from other MetroPlus departments relative to a provider’s credentialing status 10. Performs other related tasks as directed by the Director of Provider Services and the Credentialing Manager

Skills: •Excellent communication and organizational skills •Previous experience with provider credentialing processes and procedures • Knowledge of NYCHHC credentialing policies and procedures preferred •Good computer skills and able to work with MS Office •Knowledge of CACTUS preferred

Gelfand, Rennert & Feldman (“GR&F”), a well-established entertainment accounting firm in New York and Los Angeles, is seeking a Data Scientist for our Royalty Group in the Century City, Manhattan or White Plains office.
Responsibilities include:
As a member of the GR&F’s music data science team, you will take the complex data issues facing the business and make them simple
Assist the Royalty Group manage and store large volumes of music data obtained from record companies, music publishers, PROs and DSPs in connection with their engagements
Develop automated processes to increase efficiency in ingesting, consolidating, normalizing, and analyzing data
Act as liaison between Royalty Group with IT department to assess software, database, and programming options available and assist in implementation
Recommending and building new data platforms/solutions as required to meet and exceed business requirements
Own algorithm development projects from start-to-end: design, develop, QA, deploy, experiment, and analyze
Assist in training the Royalty Group on the use of newly develop automated processes
Set up and manage datarooms for clients and other third parties
Act as a resource to the Royalty Group to solve complex data problems and share complex ideas verbally and visually in an understandable manner with team members
A successful candidate will possess the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics or related field
Five or more years of previous work experience working in managing large datasets and programming
Advanced knowledge of Excel, especially Macros, Pivot Tables and formulas (such as VLOOKUP and SUMIF) Power Pivot and Power Query
Expert fluency in SQL-based data manipulation; this role will work with an array of disparate data sources so experience writing efficient, performance-optimized queries is required
In-depth experience using scripting languages such as R and Python for data analysis
Experience working with data visualization tools such as Tableau and data lake/warehouse SaaS solutions is preferred (e.g. Data Bricks)
Understand basic mathematical and accounting principles
You have the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical teams to understand and define problems, and articulate proposed solutions
Discretion and confidentiality with regards to sensitive financial transactions
The candidate must be self-motivated, detail oriented and possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as being able to work well in a team environment
This is a non-exempt position. Salary is competitive based on experience. Comprehensive benefits package includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, Wellness, 401(k), a generous paid time off policy and up to ten paid holidays per year. We offer a diverse and employee-friendly environment with great work/life balance. Gelfand, Rennert & Feldman is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Candidate education and work experience is verified during the interview process. Falsification of application information may be grounds for denying employment.
About Gelfand, Rennert & Feldman

Founded in 1967, Gelfand, Rennert & Feldman ("GRF") is a leading full-service business management firm for an exclusive assortment of entertainers, executives and select high net worth individuals. Our 30 partners and over 500 staff members deliver comprehensive financial services in the fields of music, motion pictures, television, sports, literature and other creative and performing arts. Our firm has offices in Los Angeles, New York City, Nashville, San Rafael, Wilmington and London.

Channel Sales Account Executive - New York City (remote)
When you’re driving human progress through innovative technology, you find every way you can to let the world know. That’s where Channel Sales comes in. Assigned to a particular territory or a specific partner, our teams are dedicated to driving sales of Dell Technologies products, systems and services. The focus is on getting the very best from a host of indirect sales channels. From value-added resellers to distributors and retailers, it’s about finding what works and constantly exploring ways to make it work even better. These relationships can change everything.
Join us as a Account Executive on our Outside Sales team in New York City (remote) to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
As a Channel Sales Account Executive, you will work with channel partners to identify and qualify mutually rewarding sales activities, strategies, distributors and business opportunities, all in the service of optimizing sales execution so that service level agreements are met.
You will:
Work with channel partners to identify and qualify mutually rewarding sales activities, strategies and business opportunitiesManage the channel partner relationship, engagement and achievement of joint objectives through the partner planning processIdentify cost-effective and practical alternatives for the channel by bundling products/service “solutions” to maximize our opportunity while meeting customer’s needsWork with inside sales teams and partner outside field sales teams to drive all lines of business, removing technical barriers, architecting business solutions and bringing forward new businessDevelop and implement strategies and sales campaigns for targeted accounts
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
8 to 12 years of related field sales experienceAptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problemsStrong communication, collaboration, negotiation and executive presentation skills and the ability to provide insight and thought leadership to senior level leadership and executives
Desirable Requirements
Bachelor’s degree
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Oversee textile product development, logistics, and procurement with Chinese factories (overseas vendors/suppliers). Specific duties include:

Gather detailed data and up-to-date information from industry recognized magazines, news, and trade shows in China and US and use this information together with feedbacks from US customers and analysis on competitors to develop new products.
Work with Chinese designers to decide the designs, functions, and patterns of the new products.
Collect quotes regarding the costs of the raw materials and production costs from various Chinese factories to manufacture the products. Request samples from potential Chinese factories. Project the costs for the new products – collect raw material and production costs and estimate the shipping and storage fees.
Research on new products – find similar products in China and US and compare prices and qualities. Analyze current market situation in both China and US to project market price for the new products. Obtain price quoting from existing US clients with the help of the sales team.
Prepare detailed profit and cost analysis in Excel using the new products’ costs and prices data collected and projection of future sales trend and volumes in China and US for the new products.
Summarize the product research results with detailed analysis and graphs and tables for illustration in Chinese Mandarin and present the findings in Chinese to senior management.
Manage product development and production specifications with Chinese manufacturers. Coordinate sampling process and production schedules. Negotiate manufacturing costs with Chinese factories. Source new vendors. Oversee the purchase and import of home linen products from China for wholesale and retail.
Compare and negotiate product prices with Chinese factories. Track and coordinate the import of products from China. Respond to questions and inquiries from overseas suppliers, and customers through oral and written communications in both Chinese and English.
Oversee inventory control – calculate inventory turnover ratios and allocate the inventories properly to save space, money, and time using Excel models. Work with V-Lookups, Pivot Tables, charts and graphs in Microsoft Excel.
JOB REQUIREMENT: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Marketing or a related field plus 2 years of experience. Foreign degree equivalent is acceptable. Chinese (Mandarin) proficiency is a must. Experience to include working with V-Lookups, Pivot Tables, charts and graphs in Microsoft Excel.

HOURS: 40 hours per week, M-F, 9:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.

JOB LOCATION: 230 Fifth Avenue, Suite 512, New York, NY 10001

CONTACT: Mail resume referencing job code 0917MA to Human Resources, Peking Linen, Inc., 230 Fifth Avenue, Suite 512, New York, NY 10001.

JOB SUMMARY:
L'OCCITANE’s North America Marketing Team is looking for a Manager of Organic Social Media to support the maintenance and growth of its social media channels. The right candidate should have extensive knowledge of the social landscape, a passion for content strategy and creation, and the ability to execute and analyze the results of full-scale campaigns.
Reporting to the Content Director, the Manager of Organic Social Media will be integral to the brand team's effort to position the brand to new customer bases, elevate the brand’s perception, and tell L’OCCITANE’s story through implementing organic social-based campaigns. This includes (but is not limited to) working cross-functionally with the marketing team to plan campaigns; overseeing and managing an in-house team and external agencies; quantitative analysis of overall campaigns’ key KPIs and contribution to overall brand health; forecasting and planning campaign reach; as well as supporting the channel teams with any other special quantitative and qualitative projects that may arise.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Own organic social branding strategy and manage scheduling & analytics tools (Socialbakers, Tribe, Olapic)
Innovate in the social space and grow L’Occitane presence on key platforms (Instagram, Facebook), grow newer platforms (TikTok), and evolve strategy to market relevancy and trends
Partner with campaign marketing, branding, and channel (digital, ecommerce, retail, wholesale, social selling) teams to align social content calendar with key brand moments
Be the consistent voice of our Brand to the customers:
Craft end-to-end messaging via effective & engaging storytelling formats to bring customers into the world of L’Occitane
Provide an amazing Customer experience, conveying L’Occitane values & commitments in the social community, includes but not limited to positive chat requests promptly, accurately, and courteously
Work with Customer Service to Monitor and respond to positive Customer requests on social media platforms in real-time utilizing social media management platforms, respond to organic requests and those on paid ads
Moderate product reviews and escalate to Customer Service and Retail Teams when necessary to contact customers who write poor reviews (mentioning competitors, their specific CS experiences, store experiences, defective products, etc…)
Develop, maintain, distribute local social content calendar based on International calendar
Responsible for creating adapted and original copy, curating images/video based on already available assets, shooting new imagery with in-house Graphic Designers, and scheduling and managing the posting cadence
Work closely with PR, influencer, and digital media teams to amplify influencer and organic social posts with paid media budget
Identify & implement opportunities around media efficiency, integrative media, and/or customer experience as part of ACQ roadmap
Drive iterative testing & learning throughout the year to improve program
Daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting and presentations.
Track & synthesize ongoing trends in organic social to ensure we are best in class (in the retail sphere, beauty sphere, among direct competitors, etc.)
Use Google Analytics to track sales and traffic for social campaigns, using proper tagging
Use social monitoring tool to show monthly reports
Lead projects and scope launches of new social tools or opportunities
Content & Photo Studio Management
Lead the creation of an in-house photo studio in our NYC office. Manage equipment list in partnership with Content Director and own schedule for the studio.
Lead social media content creation strategy
Build a culture of fun content creation, encouraging employees and community members to leverage the studio
Entrepreneurial mindset – strategize to grow the studio by offering up for external use.
KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS:
Brand Health Metrics, Sales, CPM, engagement, follower growth
REQUIREMENTS:
Must “live and love” Organic Social Media; staying up to date on trends, best practices, and innovations is a must.
Qualitative and quantitative analytical skills are mandatory, with an ability to forecast and report out number-based KPIs.
Must be able to function in a fast-paced environment and juggle multiple responsibilities.
EDUCATION
Bachelor’s degree completed.
EXPERIENCE
At least 4-5 years of work experience; with experience in a Social Marketing role.
Personal social media expertise is a plus.
SKILLS
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), Social Media Scheduling Tools & Google Analytics.
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to define and meet project deadlines.
Strong external partner/agency management skills required.
Willing to work in a business development role while driving day-to-day business.
Strong project management skills.
PHYSICAL & TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
Must be able to work in normal office conditions
Must be able to travel via airplane within the U.S. and Internationally more than 30% of the time
L’Occitane North America offers a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefit offering that includes: Medical, Dental & Vision Plans, Healthcare, Dependent Care, Transit and Parking Flexible Spending Accounts, Life Insurance, 401(k) Plan, Generous L’Occitane discount, Paid Vacation, Personal Days, Summer Fridays and Holidays.
L’Occitane North America is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce. We are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination based on age, color, disability, marital or parental status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other legally protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
Employment is subject to verification of references and background check investigation.

job_description:
Overview:

For forward-thinking companies that breathe life into our wardrobes, car interiors, furniture and more, Lectra is committed to crafting the premium technologies they desire. Facilitating the digital transformation of their industry, Lectra empowers brands and manufacturers from design to production, providing them with the market respect and peace of mind they deserve. Founded in 1973, today Lectra has 34 subsidiaries across the globe serving customers in over 100 countries.
The Account Director’s primary function is to increase Lectra’s market share by selling solutions that create value for our customers. This includes selling solutions and projects using various combinations of the company’s broad product and services portfolio. This position will also be responsible for developing and implementing account strategies and plans, thereby maintaining Lectra’s market leading position.
Responsibilities:

Within a list of Fashion and Apparel accounts, the Account Director will:
Develop a strategy and relationship network within each assigned account to lead to the sale of Lectra products and services
Achieve or exceed the budgeted objectives.
Develop the business aggressively to increase market share, create new reference accounts and carry out segment penetration.
Create Strategic Account Plans that detail activities that drive revenues. Present internally to gain agreement. Coordinate activities to ensure success.
Strategically enhance existing relationships and develop new relationships to ensure a profitable long-term partnership within the Customers’ organizations including its ecosystem
Strengthen the existing business through regular customer reviews to identify and win new project opportunities.
Collaborate with local and corporate sales, marketing, and professional services to review strategies for existing customers while also identifying new customer opportunities.
Utilize the CRM on a daily basis to manage and update opportunities, develop overall pipeline, and forecast business closures.
Relations:
Work extensively with external clients.
Interact frequently with local and Corporate Sales, Professional Services and Marketing departments
Qualifications:

Education and Experience:
Four-year Degree and/or equivalent relevant experience, preferably in Business or Manufacturing
Enterprise selling experience: 3-5 years’ experience in the sale of enterprise ideally in software design; e.g., ERP, Supply Chain, PLM
Knowledge of CAD and/or CAM Software is also nice to have
Experience employing a consultative, solution based sales methodology. Challenger Sale is a plus
Proven success in managing Large Accounts.
Track record achieving sales targets and building strong customer relationships at C-Level with current and new accounts.
SFDC CRM software experiences are a plus.
Understanding of Fashion and Apparel Industry (nice to have).
Position Qualifications:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including high-level sales and presentation skills.
Proven ability to generate new business within new and existing accounts and drive projects at the C-level.
Ability to qualify needs and translate into solutions for the customer.
Demonstrated ability to work well under tight deadlines and pressure without compromising standards.
Proven track record selling directly to customers (B2B) and the ability to develop and negotiate deals.
Travel:
50% travel to prospects, customers and Lectra offices.

We provide equal employment opportunity for all persons without regard to race, color, national origin, language, religion, age, sex, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, ancestry, citizenship, or political opinion.

company: New York State Office of the Attorney General
job_description:
Detective Supervisor: Auto Insurance Fraud Unit (AIFU) – New York City


The Office of the Attorney General is seeking qualif ied candidates for Detective Supervisor.

Candidates should be hard-working, motivated and committed to public service on behalf of the

people of the State of New York.


In 2001, in response to the increase in no-fault insurance fraud, the governor signed

Executive Order 109, appointing the Attorney General as the special prosecutor for auto

insurance fraud. Since 2002, AIFU has brought felony charges against hundreds of defendants,

including doctors, lawyers, healthcare providers, steerers, lay people, and hospital employees.

AIFU continues to investigate and prosecute no-fault fraud and other types of auto insurance fraud.


The qualifications for this position are: At least five years of experience supervising

investigative staff; proficiency in the areas of insurance fraud and automobile crimes; expert

interviewing and interrogation skills and the ability to memorialize information; expertise in

collection of evidence and executing search and arrest warrants; extensive experience in

undercover operations involving surveillance; extensive experience in illegal narcotics

enforcement; experience testifying in various courts; established contacts at the city, state

and federal levels within the law enforcement community serving the greater NYC area.


Please respond to Reference No. INV_AIFU_NYC_9327_012822 as outlined below. Deadline for

responding is January 28, 2022.


Qualifications in addition to those listed above:


Must have at least ten years of law enforcement experience and current NYS basic police school

certif ication.


Must possess a valid NYS driver’s license and have the ability to drive a motor vehicle.


The Public Officer’s Law requires that police officers at the OAG be citizens of the United States and

reside in New York State.


Performance of the duties may require frequent, unscheduled work on evenings and

weekends and requires 24/7 availability. This position is in the exempt class, and incumbents

serve at the pleasure of the Attorney General.


Applications are being received online. To apply, please click on this link:

INV_AIFU_NYC_9327_012822. Applicants will be taken to the online application page for this

position. Applicants must be prepared to submit a complete application packet consisting of a cover

letter (include Reference No. INV_AIFU_NYC_9327_012822) and resume. Please note: Failure to

submit a complete application will delay the consideration of your application. You may address your

cover letter to Investigator Jobs.


Per Office of the Attorney General policy, confirmation of vaccination status is a condition of

employment for this position. If you are not fully vaccinated, you will be required to provide negative

COVID-19 test results once weekly. The agency will consider religious and reasonable

accommodations.


For questions about an Investigator position with the OAG, the application process or assistance with

submitting your application, please email Investigator.jobs@ag.ny.gov or call 518-776-2500.

These positions are in the exempt class, and incumbents serve at the pleasure of the Attorney

General.

Candidates from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

The OAG is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to workplace diversity.
